reviews.review: Nice for shopping . While visiting Kathmandu, you must visit Thamel. You will find anything you want from local restaurants to fancy ones, coffee shops , bars and early night clubs with band / live music, souvenirs, Bhudda statues, books and music shops, literally anything you need..You only need to be good in bargaining :) and you get the best deal ... Happy shopping :)

Very commercial place. I came Kathmandu 17 years ago and Thamel has sigificant changes this time. No more buff running around and the cars are well washed without much dust. However, the old people and business are driven away by the more competitive shops and business leaving a very commercial place without soul. By the way, it is always the unreplacable centre of Kathmandu. Just go there to have a look if you are not living there.
Shopping. Crazy shoppingarea. In a good way. Books, clothes, tea, jewelry....you name it. Also a lot rooftop cafés and restaurant. Good for sunseekers.
Inspirational. Thamel is a hub of all cultures.Fire & Ice Pizza & ice cream is a must.There are lots of trekking shops and great nepalese restaurants.
the city is very dirty and poluted. Kathmandu is a very dirty city and very poluted with little to see. better to visit the mountain areas
Crazy streets. Best place to roam in Kathmandu. So beautiful streets and so much to shop around. You get to see people from all the countries.

Funky, but needs some tlc. Still the eclectic craziness, but it needs some care. The roads are in a bad shape at the moment, but it's fun to walk around and experience a little craziness with the crowds from around the world and folks selling almost anything.

Heaven in earth . Thamel is a wonderfull place to roam around in the night ..the place is alive at night with bright and colourfull lights with nepali rock as well as classic songs and all the traditional shops and others things which pleases the heart of the visitor
Imagine town for all kind of tourist. Versatile of facility with a lot of perpetuity as like hotel, restaurant, club, spa, handicraft shop,, Atm, etc..

Hang-outs,Pubs,Bars- Most lively tourist spot of Kathmandu. Its a place popular with tourists and have lots of bars/pubs/restaurants/speciality foods/inexpensive lodgings/massage/spa etc... whatever you require as a tourist when it kathmandu- thamel offers all.A must visit.
Awesome Place. Stay inside Thamel streets what a fun place to shop eat and sightsee the different people. Seemed very safe and the pastry shops are great.

Messy but necessary. I doubt that there would be a traveller to Kathmandu that doesn't find themselves here. This messy, claustrophobic neighbourhood is a magnet for tourists, as it has virtually all the western necessities that one would seek, as long as you're also willing to pay a little premium to eat and sleep here. However, this place is most definitely its own little ecosystem and is not entirely representative of greater Kathmandu.

Tourist ghetto. Not great. Polluted, dirty place where you get hassled all the time. Trekking agents have got more sleazy. They start by offering you treks then smoke then girls! Stay somewhere else in Kathmandu, Freak Street area is better.

overcrowded and dirty. I'm sure people say the fun part of shopping is the bargaining, but I swear, these shop keepers just double charge anyone who is not a local. On top of that, the place is crowded, full of motorbikes and people and even large vehicals. The roads are narrow and there is no proper garbage disposal system.
Tourist place. Thank is basically a tourist place in Kathmandu, Nepal. There are many bars and hotels available for the tourists. However It's a very congested and crowded place.

Crazy, colourful and full of life. This area of Kathmandu allowed my granddaughter and I to experience so much. The shopping to cater for Trekkers is everywhere. Walking through the streets you see glorious fabrics everywhere, not only hanging from shop awnings, but worn by the people. Incense burns, chanting, kids playing, cars, bikes and so much more. You look past the uneven paths, or lack of them, the noise, smell of cars, and you feel the beautiful peace of the people. We found 2 book shops. In one my granddaughter didn't want to leave the selection of books she loved and in the other, the Tibetan owner spent time and taught me about singing bowls.

Crowded. Very crowded and a lot of pressure to spend money. Not clean and very loud. Use is as a base to move to more serene locations in the mountains but I wouldn't recommend it for longer than a week at most.

Maze of shops. I really enjoyed walking around Thamel. It was a warren of shops ... and yes, they can be repetitive of content, but enjoyable all the same. Be prepared to bargain for anything you purchase, which means starting low! Most shops were distinctly "Nepalese", but there were other items on sale, as well as plenty of familiar places to eat as a Westerner. Carry a map, or you may get a bit lost!

Beautiful streets.. Thamel is the tourist hub of Kathmandu. Every time you can see tourists walking here. So many shops are on the both sides of the road. You get everything here. Let it be clothes jewellery handicrafts fruits etc etc.. my favourite place to roam when I m in Kathmandu. People sprinkle water on the streets to keep them dust free for some time.

Still Crazy after all these years!. I first experienced the craziness of Thamel 30 years ago, we revisited 10 years ago and again just last week. It really is still crazy, but wonderfully so! Very touristy but great place for shopping, eating, planning your trekking or rafting trip, getting a haircut or shave and having a beer and watching the world go by. Not to be missed!

A Trekkers Dream!. Thamel has EVERYTHING you need to prepare for a multi day trek in the Himalayas - and its all SO cheap. The shop vendors are not pushy and it was so much fun bartering with them. We all got really into the game :D We had such a good two days wondering around and equipping ourselves with all the necesities and even presents for back home! Lovely place to spend a couple days

Convenient to eateries and souvenirs. Very lively and hence very noisy and dusty as well.. However, it is very close to amenities such as travel agents, restaurants, supermarkets and souvenirs. If you are looking for a place to stay, try to find a hotel along a less busy alley..

Shops n Shops n shops. Thamel road was narrow and congested but lots and lots of shops. You will find many gully (lanes). All the lanes were clean and shop keepers were friendly and had to do lot of bargaining

Experience . After staying in this region, I found the first day such a culture shock. Very busy with people, scooters cars etc on very narrow streets. Once over the shock it's great but watch out for the tiger balm and flute sellers. They can be 'eager' to sell and don't always take no first a first answer. Definitely recommend looking up dos and don'ts of etiquette before travelling there.

A nightmare of a place filled with vile motorbikes. What a shame the Nepalese Government does not care about tourists. Thamel is designed to take the tourist dollar. It's filled with shops, restaurants bars and hotels. Yet the roads here are too narrow to accommodate all the traffic; tourists, locals, street sellers and cars. The motorbikes speed through as fast as possible, nearly knocking down everyone in sight. Their horns pressed down loud and long, resulting in angry aggressive streets. The Nepalese are the nicest people in the world, but put them on a bike and all they care about is getting from A to B - if you're in the way you have to jump in the gutter or risk getting hit. This area could be a wonderful place to browse, shop and spend yet the traffic is relentless. It’s a horror. I have seen many tourists look uncomfortable and distressed when almost rammed by a bike. I wonder why there's no traffic management, maybe a speed limit and a ban of horns. It's not impossible to implement?
Vacation . Brill place fantastic people so much to do the restaurant ,bars and shopping are so enjoyable to visit and to eat .the people in thamel well kathmandu in general will make you welcome

controlled chaos. ...I agree that this is a place catering to tourist but that shouldn't be a bad thing. I don't understand why some repeat visitors call it touristy but keep coming back to visit the area.this places is a mash up of the 405 freeway in Los Angeles, the foot traffic in Times Square in New York during New Year's Eve, and the vendors in manhattan's chinatown canal street. also, add a very dusty maze of roads running through the area. stop by, check the area out and check it off your list. good experience or bad, at least you can say that you've experienced it!I walked through the area and spent about 2 hours walking through the labyrinth of roads leading to different areas.
Shopping and Laundry. We have visited Thamel several times to get our laundry done and look around. We've bought gifts here for friends and family back home .

The tourist ghetto. Thamel is a lot of fun. It's all small and crowded streets where you can buy for all types of craftwork as well as trekking gear (they say to be The North Face....but they are all fakes). This is a small happy island of Kathmandu filled with bars, pubs, restaurants, clubs and massage places. If you come to Kathmandu this is the most likely place for your hotel or hostal to be. But this is not the real Kathmandu.If you want to buy something, you have to offer at least half the price they tell you. If they say they charge 800 rupies, tell them you will pay 400. And even so....you may find it cheaper on the next shop.
Tourist. Tourist palace in kathmandu is really good and locetion really intrested palace ither thamel is more intrested palace far tourist

Interesting . Stayed in Thamil. Had all the things u need for trekking or just shopping. Many hotel to suit all budgets. Can find all sorts of food. This area most suitable for visitors to stay. However if wanted to experience real Nepal life, you have to go out of Thamil.

Stay here - can't imagine being anywhere else. Trekkers, travellers - want cheap hiking gear or climbing gear brand names at a third of the price ( copy if course)Cashmere in ready supply Heritage sites/ markets I wouldn't stay anywhere else - yes,it can be busy but if you want quite stay out of the city Love this area - enough people to ensure i always felt safe as i was a female travelling solo
Tourist part of the city. Nice place if you want to find nice restaurants, but keep in mind that is a very crowded place. Lot of party, restaurants and spas

Two days in Thamel is more than enough. In short: This was my third visit to Nepal. Thamel is and will always be the only area of KTM, where most newly arrived tourists / backpackers spend their first night, coming from the airport.Cons:I agree with the rest of the comments, dirty, crowded, dusty and rip off tourist touts / shops, selling fake trekking gear and artifacts. Cars and motorcycles honking every 5 sec. Pros:Meeting up with fantastic other westerners, and exchanging travel stories. Several very good Local restaurants, being very friendly and polite.The mountains, the mountains, the mountains. Let's face it, if it weren't for the Himalayas.......

Vibrant Place. Nepal visit is incomplete if one can't plan to visit Thamel. It's tourist attraction and surrounded by all happening things apart from Many Shops to purchase Tea, Pashmina, Music and Dance Bar as well

Poor Thamel!. I have been visiting Nepal for many many years and always stay in Thamel. This year, I think, is the worst that I have seen it in a very long time. The noise from the traffic has increased you can't hear yourself think. The growth in the number of motor bikes is unbelievable and driving skills and road sense non existent most of the time. Traffic police take no notice. Whilst there the streets were continually being dug up to repair pipes, the repairs were not good and pipes continued to leak (which meant the road had to be dug up again) with an awful sewage smell which made walking through parts of Thamel very unpleasant and to be avoided. Very sad to see.

Great part of Kathmandu. Thamel is a great tourist epicentre of Kathmandu. We spent over all 5 nights in Thamel, either side of a Trek. There is plenty to see and do. Lots of street vendors/ shops with local products. A must see/ stay when in Kathmandu.
Thamel is a wonderfull place to shop!. go there if you want the bieautifullness of the shopping of india, but in the calm, clean and respectfullness of Nepal!and find very good restaurants!
Shop till you drop!. What a fun and overwhelming place to visit for shopping and eating, greeting and meeting the culture of Kathmandu

Crazy busy but awesome!. Oh Thamel! What a place, granted it's the tourist area but it's a good one! There is everything you want and more! Some tourist areas are as useful as they are a bit rubbish as you can't find a local person in sight, this isn't always the case here! There is so much to do in this area it will keep you busy for a while! Easy to stay with good accommodation and great places to eat!
Great view of the culture. Its a great place to visit by tourists. Very innovative and nice handicrafts. Gives a true flavor of the culture and local traditional items.
Good tourist place. Thames is one of the most important part of tourist to live and travel around TO meny tourist activity like hotel restaurants sparked shaping area bars etc
Good shopping spree. You just hv to walk in the lane n u will b able to buy all u need for urself, family n friends. Check out the necklaces.

Shopping neighborhood. At first Thamel seems a chaotic place, while it is a great place offering a lot about culture. The stores have many souvenirs and things about Nepal as well as many restaurants of different choices.

Wanted to love it (but didn't). Although I recommend staying in the Thamel area given the accessibility to shops, restaurants and cafes, the streets themselves are hard to enjoy: no footpaths mean that you're constantly dodging beeping cars and motorcyclists, and the streets are dirty, muddy and filled with potholes. There were a few items by the roadside we'd have liked to take a closer look at, but gave up since the constant traffic gave us no peace. Instead, we found ourselves ducking into cafes to escape the constant chaos. We went multiple times and unfortunately felt the same each time.

Stay at Thamel. Thamel is the Mecca of Trekkers. You'll get everything, right from stay, food, equipment, guides, shopping destinations to supermarkets. If you're coming to Nepal and staying at Kathmandu... Thamel is the place to be...

Ms. I love Thamel!! Been here many times. Yes, it's touristy, busy and bustly .But very good natured, colourful market vibe. Heaps of interesting little shops, marvellous pashminas, great eating places of all types everywhere. Excellent people watching. And the Nepalese people are so nice. Yes, they approach you and try to sell to you but they're also ready to take a hint and back off. You need to watch your feet and the motor bikes but it's not too intimidating. Not to be missed.
The Most visited part. The Most visited part of city. there are a lot of shops sells almost all the same kind of products but this is realy nice to be visited area for the city.
Best area in Kathmandu. Thamel has atmosphere, shops, the trekking / mountaineering feel about it, excitement & it just a pleasure to walk around this energetic area, which is the heart of Kathmandu

Every corner bustling with life . This is the paradise for adventure gear shoppers. Be sure to pick what you really want and have fun bargain. There are some travel agencies as well as money changers in Thamel. Walk a but further n you may reach the whole sale area. Ask around and you will be directed fo it. Or take a rickshaw ride ro take in the scene of this unique place called thamel. i never get enough of it each time I am here. dRop by before your treka and you can get your gears drop by after your treks and your can replenish your gears for the next trip. Rain pants rain coats trekking poles back packs and socks and shoes can be found in abundance.

Bustle, bustle, touts and hustles.. Based in Thamel, we've passed through its streets every day of our trip here and have got to know it well enough to navigate easily now. Yes, it's thronged, packed, busy, full of local trousers for everything from souvenirs to eating establishments to trek operators to ... Purveyors of things not so legal. But, for the most part, all will leave you alone soon enough if you simply ignore them - not as persistent as other places like India. A great place to stroll, shop, eat and run into unexpected ed temples and stupas and marvel at some of the architecture of the local houses. Always something to see - even the odd monkey traversing the overhead power lines!

Absolutely Crazy . Probably the craziest places I've ever experienced. Loud, smelly, dirty, crowded. Lots of shopping, lots of fakes, hard to know if you're being ripped off or not. Thing is though, if you're coming to Kathmanu you need to see it.

Loved the hustle and bustle. I enjoyed shopping and wandering in Thamel. It was vibrant, colourful and a range of small shops to visit and fossick for bargains. The people were lovely when you wanted to chat, but some have limited English of course. I loved it.
Such character. Great place for shopping and dining. Make sure you barter in the shops...they are very easy to negotiate with. Just smile and enjoy. Safe area for tourists.

A step back in time. The area is peppered with shops of every kind. A number of them selling fake 'North face ' outdoor goods. The streets are narow, and dusty; so you will need to wear a mask if you wat to avoid tickly throats. The traders are open to bartering for a good price.

Stayed in Thamel; last minute shopping . This place is good for last minute shopping of things you need for trekkimg. They offer cheap stuff, of course, they are imitation. But good enough and the quality will hold during the duration of your trip. Make sure you bargain well.

Specially for Tourist Area. This area is specially for tourists. No local peoples are here. Here are lots options for having fun. Lots hotels to stay, roadside bar, fastfood, live music bar, dance bar, antique shops, cloths etc. Near about 1km area seems not in kathmandu.

Take care, the candymen are around! . Nice place but super expensive! Maybe the old freak Street is more authentic and definitely cheaper. Take care about the "candymen" and their drugs, this is so annoying... Take care at night time!

An Assault on the Senses. When you stay in or around Thamel, first, make sure it is for a short time only, i.e. at beginning and end of trek. It is infuriatingly chaotic and senses are assaulted from all directions. Loud, smelly, dirty, crowded, polluted, traffic clogged..you name it and there is a word for it. Also, although invisible to the naked eye, as a tourist, you have a sign over your head that says 'ATM'. Because that is what you are to the locals, a source of income to be tapped at every opportunity be it for Tiger Balm, tips, drugs (too many around for my liking) and those annoying students who appear from nowhere wishing to make friends with you, show you around and take you for all you can afford. Expect also, power cuts and water shortages on a regular basis. The paradox, however, is that you will find accommodation that suits every budget. Food that sort of impersonates that of which you get at home, travel agents, trekking gear shops, Thanka shops, dodgy jewellery sellers, passable coffee, supermarkets and pharmacies that will sell you antibiotics without prescriptions.

Typical Local Tourist Market. Very interesting. Exciting to look around, but know what you are looking for before you go other wise you might buy stuff you don't want. Also you must be willing to get a price, look elsewhere and then come back to the store with the best price and remember to bargain. Typical tourist market around the world with local or cultural items and if you are into hiking then may get good deals on high quality goods. I was disappointed there are no electronics, fishing nets or watches here. Have to go elsewhere. Also Travel light as it gets crowded and feels more comfortable and safe to be able to manage your items as you secure your pocket book.

Number 1 Shopping Center in Kathmandu. All the things that you need are available here. It is the largest shopping center in Kathmandu if I'm not mistaken. The only drawback here is the price of the items. Since it is a common shopping center for tourists, the rate is usually higher than other shops outside thamel. But don't worry you can ask for a discount for up to 50% or more depending on the number of items to be bought. Hotels, restaurants, travel agencies and many more are also located within the vicinity.

Bustling and Vibrant Thamel. Thamel is a must-see area in Kathmandu with many varieties of shops, restaurants and dance bars.Thamel is known as the 'Red Light' district of Kathmandu, especially at night.There are some night clubs that are open until 3:30am.Most shops are closed by 9:30pm-10pm.There is a 'western hub' area inside Thamel for tourists, this includes a shopping centre to buy your food and essentials, this shopping centre closes 9pm.Lots of clothing, hiking and souvenir shops in Thamel area.

5 stars for the crowd. . Thamel is crazy as crazy gets. Haha. Here you have everything. And for tourists like me, perhaps even for some NepaliNepal isnt Nepal without Thamel. Surely there is a lot that Nepal can offer, but Thamel definitely is a world of its own. Hotels. BEEF. Spas. Legal and Illegal. See it in Thamel.

The hustle and bustle. The streets are crazy and chaotic. But in Thamel it all seems to work. Plenty of shops selling everything from trekking gear to souvenirs to all sort of who knows what. The traffic comes from all directions so be aware of where you are walking.

Kathmandu's Home and Away for Travellers. Thamel and surrounding area is the place were most travellers find accomodation. There is a lot to choose from. Finding a preferred restaurant is a little more difficult but they are there (Fire & Ice). Be prepared for lots of chaos and noise and make sure you get lost in the alleys around the old area.. well worth it

A shoppers paradise filled with great deals and beautiful items, with amazing coffee houses and eateries l. Wander through streets where you can find gorgeous pashminas and other cashme items. Hunt for bargains on beautiful and quirky jewellery or amazing hand crafted wooden treasures. Selling everything from tiger balm to Gurkha knives and beautiful paintings. This area is well worth exploring!

A hectic gathering place for budget travelers & trekkers. Thamal is a wonderful example of the chaotic beauty of travel, and how communities adapt to cater to wanderlusters. In Thamel you can get jewelry or down jackets, pashmina scarves or ice axes. The restaurants range from crap to decent, but you can't go wrong if you use TripAdvisor. The traffic noise is non-stop, so light sleepers may ask for an interior room.
nice. i was thamel ,i like but only tourist.i find world wide everything in thamel.thamel is international place and more expensive

The place to be in Kathmandu!. After some wonderful experience in Pokhara, Bhaktapur and Nagarkot- i was asking myself "if the busy Kathmandu is any worth my time?", until i arrived in Thamel. Thamel is just another side of Nepal which never ceases to impress you. The small shops, the restaurants, the narrow streets- everything gives you positive energy.Don't forget to grab few pashmina shawls, kukris and any trekking equipments if you need them- and enjoy the sweet talks with the shop owners, they mean business and they are nice people.
Nice but very dusty. Great place to get some souvenir but very dusty. You have to negotiate everything you better be good at it

Thamel. I'm in Nepal alone. No friends. Bishnu of Himalayan Trekking made me feel at home. For very little compensation he got me great tours of Kathmandu. I think that he even paid for some of the day trips. Great guy. I strongly recommend using his service. Above and beyond service for sure.
Good for local shopping and a quick walk. Thamel is a tourist area in Kathmandu, with most of the shops selling souvenirs and trekking goods. Took an evening walk and bought some gifts for friends.

crazy wonderful world. i love thamel , just walk and get lost in the little street, in the market, enjoy all the nice restaurant , shop and the beautiful market.yes is dusty and noisy ...but can't be different and in the end i felt comfort in the chaos of thamel...

Thamel never sleeps. As they say it, Thamel never sleeps. Although there is 12am deadline, thamel is full of life.Anything you want in Nepal, you will get it in thamel. Bar/club hopping is the best thing to do here. Be careful of crooks(esp. if you are a foreigner). they will lure you into something you will regret later. Walk around the alleyways, to get the vibe of how Kathmandu was during old times.

Watch out for cheating tourist traps!!. As a newish visitor to Kathmandu (3 visits), I don't know much about the town, so tend to remain close to the hotel and surrounding areas. I've been to Thamel once before, which is basically a popular downtown type area, loaded with stores, bars and restaurants. It is also famous for shady joints like dance bars and massage parlours. Nothing wrong with then unless you have an ethical issue - to each their own. I encountered a young man by the name of Tinjin, who was a shortish fellow about 19-20 years old and very impressive Hindi/Urdu. Seemed to know his way around and ended up taking me to a bar called the 'pussycat' club. Shady as it sounds, it was a half decent but dirty as hell joint. Said his 'brother' owned it and he'd get me a nice discount. I wasn't counting on that, but figured a Simon night out and a few drinks wouldn't cost more than 3-4k Nepali rupees. Long story short, he told me the bill would be 2500, took the cash, went to the bar to pay and took too long. I went over, asked for the bill - which was bow 5,500. He insisted we have a tequila shot on the house and we could leave for another venue. I got annoyed, went out for a smoke and while the bar staff kept me busy discussing a revised bill of 7,500 - Tinjin slipped out beyond me, money in hand and his bar buddies then stuck me with the entire bill saying he isn't their staff and it's my problem now. Ended up withdrawing cash with a credit card (you know those bank fees) because I had had enough arguing my way around this. Be very careful and don't trust the locals in Thamel. Period.

Potholes Galore. Tiny little shops nestled tightly to one another, filled with all the wares, from Pashminas to Tibetan Art to Singing Bowls!!! Narrow, dusty roads full of potholes, with taxis and scooters honking continuously!! That is the hustle & bustle of Thamel that brings Kathmandu to life!!

Crazy hectic city . After a day you get used to the traffic, crowds, horn beeping and dusty roads. Lots of great activities to do and great selection of restaurants. I have very safe as a solo female.
Main tourism place . Very nice shopping are. Good for walking Hand made products. Antique souvenir shopping place. Don't forget to visit when you are in Nepal

Just a fun great place to shop. There are so many little shops and stall in this town it makes it interesting and fun to spend the day looking and haggling over the prices of similar goods. The place to be buying your cashmere and pashmina, as well the Yak wool blankets and all the other wondrous Nepalese goods.

First visit. Colourful shopping district with lots of food outlets too. Make sure you visit the Himalalayan Java cafe and take home some souvenirs. Take care when walking as no pavements and lots of traffic, motorbikes, rickshaws and cars. Take dollars as our Visa card didn't work in the ATM.
Best. Thamle is one of the individual palace to expend time for the customer to meny tourist activities and save to estay

Great place to shop, or at the very list take pictures of your favourite items. I was there to do my shopping for mountaineering stuff. You can bargain for better price. I saw so many things I want to buy, particularly the yak wool but then I heard that it was a little yak wool mixed with lots of synthetic wool. No wonder it's so cheap. So I didn't buy them. I bought the tea from the supermarket instead as it was not overpriced compared to those they sell there. There were many great place to chill for dinner and also to drink at the bar. Recommended for people who likes shopping and just hanging out.

Sukumvit or Times Square of Nepal!. Heart of the city with all the touristy stuff available - shopping, restaurants, cafes, hotels and tour/travel companies. Close to the airport as well and walking distance from Garden of Dreams.

THE MAIN TOURIST SHOPPING BELT. Thousands of shops where you can find top rated local restaurants, fake trekking products(but it's still good), supermarkets, barbers, musical instruments, gift shops, bars, etc. The belt extends out of Thamel as well, but those close pretty early. The main road of Thamel gets more happening late night.

THE tourist street . This street is essential for all travellers. It has hikers shops, supermarkets, clothes shops, hostels, restaurants, money exchange, activity planners, and night life. Keep in mind that this is not representative of all of Kathmandu though.
A must. You have to walk around in the narrow shop-fringed streets of this lively neighborhood. You will find a chaotic and noisy mixture of Nepalis, Tourists, cars, motorcycles and rikschaws.
Local market. Plenty of souvenir outlets and restaurants. Great to see the happening daily life in the local market. A bit chaotic but safe to explore yourself in it.

Busy street w Recommended trekking gear shop. . Good place to eat and shop for trekking gears. I highly recommend Mandala Outdoor Gear shop at Madala street just in front of OR2K. The owner of the shop is a very nice guy. He give reasonable price for the items he sells, not necessary to bargain for the cost. will take his afford to look for new stock on the item you want to buy. Good customer svc .

Shopping!. A maze of shops selling mostly the same touristy stuff but some gems they hide for you too find... like motherland shop selling genuine and new stuff mixed. Or the women collective selling knitwear in Annapurna market... But if you try you can find really nice things and not expensive. Of course they try to sell you at the maximum price... what would you do?Nice street food and western style at lower prices but high if you're used to outside kathmandu pricing. Alcohol is very expensive due to taxes. Try cheap local Roxy alcohol at between 90 and 160 NR and mix with cranberry juice for a nice cocktail

You can find everything here. Shopping, wandering around, eating and other things are available here ,but it's noisy, dusty and crowded. In thamel you must bargain on everything and it will help you save even 50%!!
Crazy, noisy fun.... Thamel is the hub of Kathmandu for tourists - busy, narrow streets filled with vendors, rickshaws, food and drink!

Traffic jam. Firstlt you must watch the motorbikes and taxies for your safety.There is a really traffic jam without traffic rules.Also so crowded and you can find some fake brands for climbing.Before buy something you should negotiate strongly to buy cheap.

Nice place to shop and buy souvenirs . If Bali has kuta streetwhere you can walk down the street and shop till you drop, Kathmandu has thamel. You can shop and feel the nepali style of market. Many cafes here. We visited the third eyes cafe, nice food and very nice interior. Good place to bring yr love one. Spend 1 of yr day to walk around. If you visit garden of dream, you can just walk down to thamel.
Tourist palace. Thamel is one os tourist palace in nepal far estay and shaping and eating to menny tourist activities in side around and save
Thamel. For shopping thamel is the right place. I got for me very lovely tshirt. I just want to say what lovely place. I enjoyed staying here.
Something. I was several time at place,I found global..everything in side but I like all mans are there and too busy

Personal opinion, but i just love the chaos of Thamel!!. Please, as tourists, we should behave & respect a bit more Nepali people ; don't think you suddenly are important just because you com from a richer country ; thanks for all travelers & locals ; we are all local somewhere & there is always someone far more richer than us somewhere ^^

THE famous tourist spot in Kathmandu. No one can get over with this place in a singe visit. Most famous hanging out place for tourists as well as the locals. Unending list of hotels, restaurants and pubs and bars. Centrally located. A must visit.
Tourrist palace. Thamel is one of the tourist palace tawn in kathmandu to meny tourist activity like hotel sestaurent sgaping center its id ok

One of my favourite hanging spot in K-Town. It is one of the most recommended address for those planning to visit kathmandu for the first time. It is a shopping hub for those shopping lovers as there are many souvenir shops ranging from trekking gears, pashmina, CDS, books, crystals, etc. There are also lots of restaurant catering different cuisines from around the world along with different guesthouses, hotels which is suitable for travellers from backpackers to top end quality. I love chilling out in the coffeeshops or relishing different cuisines from around the world.

The touristy neighborhood of Kathmandu. Exciting, hectic and loud! Thamel is perfect for souvenir shopping and is just a short walk away from the awesome Durbar square which you mustn't miss! We just aimlessly walked around for hours watching the residents go around their daily activities!

Bustling tourist area. Such a vibrant wonderful place to visit. there are so many little shops and stalls selling pashminas, singing bowls, flutes, rugs and a host of other touristy items. Lots of hotels and cafes. I'd recommend having GPS or a very good map if you're wondering around as the little streets can get confusing with people, bikes, rickshaws, motorbikes and miniature taxis all trying to go about their business.

Mr. Thamel the most busy market in kathmandu. Lots n lots of shops to buy historical Buddhist items made of brass. Local made agarbathis, Himalayan chai and the most happening place in the evenings and the weekends where the nightlife of kathmandu is.
Street Market daily life. The sight and sounds of Thamel is something you will remember. Shopping and just experiencing the daily life in Nepal.

Market Shopping. this place is a must to visit while in Kathmandu, a lot of souvenirs places and shopping options, its a safe place and full of people and foreigners, you can find scarfs, wool blankets tea and spices trekking items etc... we always negotiated on prices.

The best place for tourists in Kathmandu. Here you go find a lot of trekking companies, trekking gear a lot tour options. However once you do careful research before choosing the tour company and one should be aware that most of the gear are knock-offs. That said though you can still find something suitable if you need to do your trek. For example, I've had a lot of bad luck with boots. I take boots from an errand region to a tropical region and within a couple of years the glue will disintegrate or the rubber will disintegrate in the boots become worthless this is exactly what happened to me when I arrived in Kathmandu. This is a serious problem for me since I'm 6'3" and wear size 13 boots not an easy size to find. I went into the Northface shop and bought a pair of shoes or boots and they worked fine as I slogged it up to ABC in the monsoon season.

Market Place!. You will definitely visit this place if you are in Kathmandu. This place has a lot to offer. Covered with flea markets where you can bargain to the hilt. One-stop shop for the people who are looking to buy local artifacts, clothes and enjoy local food. There are enough lounge and bars to suit everyone's taste. Most of the shops here close by 8pm, but the eateries are open even after midnight. Great tattoo artists are also available here. To travel within this huge market, you can always hire an rickshaw (cycle with covered cart seats attached, driven by people).

Shopping. Lots of shopping options. Look around and bargain with the shop owners. Must get: cashmere, scarfs and yak wool blankets. Tea and spice shops have inexpensive quality product. Go to the hidden shops. Found beautiful unique tapestry made with wax in a very unassuming shop.
Chill. I like Thamel a lot. Very much safe secure and amazing nightlife it has.people are nice and helpful Nd all are happy.

Good shopping! . I downloaded the GPS MY CITY app (iPhone) and used it with my new Nepalese sim.. It took me through thamel and other great shopping areas! There is a self guided walking tour you can use which shows you where you are and where to go for good local shopping and tourist deals.
Tourist hub. Place easy access to Nepal tourism board and bus stop to pokhara. Hiking tools can be cheap however rest are at tourist price eg tea. Accommodation can be easily available in September

It is the heart of Kathmandu. Thamel is the main market place in Kathmandu. You can find lots of Dance Bar on the street. Don't try to take chance to have a sip with Sweet Nepali Beauties in these Dance Bars

Place specifically targeted for tourists. You can get anything for tourists here. From trekking and peak climbing gears and equipment to book/music store, arts, crafts, restaurants to pubs and from luxury hotel to budget lodges..
Popular with tourist. Filled with restaurants, hotels and closest to Durbar Square and other 5 stars. You can do good bargain in the shops of Thamel.
Place were your shopping ends. Great Place to full fill your shopping...in Nepal do visit this place as you will get every thing you need...

touristic hangout thamel. thamel actually is a place for activities , you can find lots nice hotels, restaurants , travel agencies , cafe , spa , jewellery shops , garments shops , souvenir shops , pubs ,discos in thamel , the place is mostly crowded with tourists from all around the world
good ciry. one of the tourist palace call thamel is really good and safe to walk around alone to menny tourist activity in side

Lovely tourist city. wow ! Thamel was incredibly great city. When we walked three minutes from.our hotel we reached the main street of Thamel and it has hundreds of great cafe , bars, clubs , shopping points etc. It was very easy to shop and all handycrafts and antiques are available. shopper's heaven. what do you want? Fancy shawl, shoes, Poncho, jewellery bag, jacket, pants, local dresses and much more you can find in Thamel. Pure Madness But A Fun District . This is my second time to stay in the Thamel area in the last 6 years and to be honest I don't think I'd stay anywhere else. nine city . themel is tourism area where you can find many hotels and restaurants. and reasonable shopping areas.

Fabulous shopping ..clothing, pashimas, handcrafts and jewellery. The shops are mostly wholesale offering a rich variety of Nepalese handcrafts, clothing and jewellery. There are musicians walking around touting hand made instruments and you can use a rickshaw to transport you to the inner city

Tourist centre. Great place if you like shopping, some good places to eat or to organize a trek. But if youre looking for an authentic Nepalese experience youll have to get far away from Thamel as it is essentially a tourist theme park.

Too touristy for my liking. I went to Nepal to experience the chaos and the crowds (not quite as overwhelming as big Indian cities, but still a sensory overload!). My second home. I loved this part of the city. I made a few friends there. Lots of lovely small shops with everything ready for tourists. It was a bit more expensive there, but if you walked only a few streets further the prices were ok. There are many restaurants with very tasty food.

My 5th visit to thamel. It is by far the best place to be in Kathmandu. Lounges, bars, shopping, restaurants, coffee shops ,you will find practically everything in Thamel. If you love club hopping with cheap drinks and live music, thamel is your perfect destination in Kathmandu. Purple haze, seesha are best for live bands and you will find countless dingy reggae bars in thamel. Food is available but most of the shops get shut by 9 pm. Early breakfast options are in plenty. But beware of your surroundings..be responsible as thamel is famous for pub brawls.

Colorful, lively, touristy. When in Kathmandu, on cannot miss Thamel. It seems hat this is the touristic center of Kathmandu. Nearly everything can be found here. From small shops selling incence, supermarkets, ATMs over restaurants and hotels to temples and holy sites. Very lively and colorful.Be aware that the streets are often very chaotic and you will be close to traffic. Once you embrace the chaos, it is a great place to explore. But after a long day in Thamel, you'll be happy to return to your quiet hotel room.A must-see when in Kathmandu.

Nightlife in Kathmandu. This popular tourist area will allow you to wonder through the narrow streets, with ample local bars and restaurants to choose from. lots of local art and souvenirs to choose from. Best is to stay in one of the recommended hotels.

Great place, friendly people and awesome food. The people here are friendly and not too in your face like some places, if you say you don't want to buy on the whole they leave you aloneThe food has all been great We walked around and got lost in the sticks and have at no point felt in secure, the locals spotted we were off the beaten track and pointed us in the right direction

Sights and Sound. Definitely a cultural shock at Thamel. I stayed in Thamel and was overwhelmed with the people, food, shops. Basically, all walks of life in Thamel. A lot cheaper than tourist trap area such as temples, stupas, etc.Thamel is a place for trekkers and backpackers visit to buy food, water, clothing, medicine prior to their expedition. For coffee lover, tried Java Coffee for your coffee fix and early morning breakfast.Apparently, there are two Northface stores in Thamel and a Mountain Hardware outdoor clothing and equipment stores. Most other shops sells knock-off outdoor clothing; can negotiate prices.Prepare for load shedding or when the hotel or business turn off the electricity.

Must visit and don't be afraid to haggle.. Go and stay here for a few days then get out and explore the country. Thamel is set up for tourists and makes travelling easy. Colourful and lively.. The tourist hub of Kathmandu is vibrant and bright... lots of shops selling trekking wear, woolen creations, jewellery, woven goods, cafes and restaurants. Rickshaws, taxis and vendors cry out for your attention. Streets are narrow and crowded. A fun visit, and a lot of variety if you are looking for a bite to eat or something to take home.Watch out for scams. Especially the powdered milk scam!

Beware of ATMs on Thamel road.. While visiting Thamel road is definitely an attraction I would recommend if you're going to Kathmandu beware of the ATM there. My dad tried withdrawing money at one, and his card was rejected twice so we just went and found another one. We realised later that his card was actually debited the two times he tried and other transactions had since been made on his card. So, we had to block his card to avoid anymore misuse. The ATM we used was one similar to any of the other ATMs on the street. So if you need money I would recommend having a daily budget and exchanging on site your foreign currency (they have many foreign money exchange on Thamel with better exchange rates than at the airport or hotels). Most restaurants and bars and even some shops (although not many) take cards as well and we never had any problems with that.

A definite must while in Kathmandu. I travel to Kathmandu frequently and you cannot go to this city with out visiting Thamel. This is a section of town where you can find many tourists ad also locals. It's a great place to purchase outerwear, carpets,teas, souvenirs and anything else you might want to bring home from your travels. There are good restaurants and it will definitely give you a treat to your senses.

Convenient, but a little too crowded and touristy. Surround with amenities and hotels, making it one of the most popular tourist spots. However, it is a little too crowded and dusty to my own liking (as compared to Pokhara). Definitely a place to go if you're into the buzz of cities.

I really liked people and the atmosphere there.気さくで親しみやすい日本人の奥さんが、パシュミナについてのアドバイスを丁寧にしてくださるので、安心して購入できます。タメルの他のお店より、少し高いように思えるかもしれませんが、なぜそうなのか？などきちんと説明をしてくださるし、日本で買うことを思うと、良いものを、本当に安く購入できるので、全然高すぎるとは感じないと思います。お店も、可愛くて、おしゃれなので、少し覗くだけでもほっこりした気持ちになれると思います。

Great place but poor people. Avoid the strangers & the bars especially the dance bars!!! there is one close to the music shop where customers are ripped off royally!!! if only we knew this.. the bill for a can of beer came as 8000 Nepali Rupees!!! when refused to pay they threatened and an army of 7-8 locals came hitting us mercilessly.. ultimately had to empty the wallet as they would'nd let us go at any cost no matter how much u plead.. extremely horrendous and unexpected experience this was but it is something every tourist should be made aware so as to be careful about their trip to Thamel.

6 days @ Kathmandu, no trekking. . August, 2016We came during "monsoon" season and we stay for 6 days. The first 4 days we did "day tours" around KTM, no trekking. We booked them with a touristic agency in Thamel. First day: private tour to Patan and Bhaktapur: 60 usd 2 people.Second day: group tour to main manasteries/temples and main square: pashupatinath, budhanilkantha, Boudhanath, kathmandu durbar square, swayambhunath. 20 usd 2 people. Third: group tour, river rafting.60 usd 2 people. Fourth: shopping in Thamel and massageFifth: Kopan monastery and durbar square. Sixth: relax + flight back. It is important that whenever they offer you an itinerary you asked them as much details as possible. Example: if they tell you that you will be picked up from your hotel/Hostal you clarify if it will be done by car or someone will come walking and that will be your "pick up" -that happened to us-If they hired you a taxi for sightseeing ask if they will use a/c or not. We got cases were no a/c was used, and it was hot! Also how long they will wait you in each sightseeing. Taxis around KTM should be less than 500 rs. 500 rs can be from Thamel to Kopan Monastery which is around 15 km. Also, most of this touristic agency are kind of brokers. They will simply add you to a bigger group.Kathmandu people is friendly but ensure you bargain. A bottle of water can be 20 rs (tourist standar) probably for the locals is 10 rs. If they feel you are coming from a wealthy county it can be 40 rs so.. This apply for everything you buy or service you want. In KTM some roads are full of dust or simply are dust so you will see a lot of locals wearing mask. If you suffer from respiratory illness, get a mask.Food is very good we looked for the top 10 restaurant in trip advisor and we found very good restaurants. 1000 rs standard budget for this kind of restaurants.We stayed at Avalon house KTM, place was great. Enjoy!

Kathmandus Meeting Aerea for people coming from round the world.. A very busy aerea with unnumerable business,shops,agencies,restaurants andseveral kind of services.Thamel offers many western foods and drinks ,what seemsto be very attractive to their visitors from abroad.The only negative impressions forme was the extreme noisy and partwise brutal drivings of small motor-cycles up tohuge monster-cars in the narrow streets of Thamel.Not a good advertising to comeagain!

How to enjoy Thamel. To really enjoy Thamel, you've got to get up early, before the streets are busy, and just keep walking! Enjoy the early markets and talk with people. By noon, it's full of cars and smog to best to retreat to a cafe by then!

After all those years, still THE place to go in KTM. I've been coming to Thamel for more than 30 years now, and it is still THE place to go to for western tourists: lots of restaurants, shops, hotels -- anything you might want to find in a foreign city. No idea where to go? go to Thamel

Tourist city spot. For a night in Nepal or first time nervous traveller Thamel is bustling with Tourist wanderers with price tags to suit. Souvenirs, trekking clothing, western cuisine is all plentiful here.

Tourist attraction. This is the place where you can get all the gears for your trekking. It highly tourist targeted place so it is busy all the time. It is not really a bug area but this is in fact a compact tourist area with good restaurant, guest houses and boutiques.
Tourist Market of Nepal. Thamel is Famous Place for every Tourist who visit in Nepal. Here we can get anything whatever we want. there is so many Hotel, Restaurant. Bar and many More..

Colorful!. Awesome place. Colorful and vibrant. Take a casual stroll into the market filled with eye catching colors of clothes and local jewelry. You can pick up some really beautiful artwork or painting or get your hands on a pashmina. Every person on the street will tell you that his pashmina is original. Just be cautious what you buy. At night the place transforms into a party zone. Music and revelry in every corner. Don’t miss this place
Vibrant Thamal. Busy, colourful, can get most things there including practical items like toiletries, or beautiful clothes and jewellery, or trekking gear.
Thamel day trip. Great place to shop. Very cheap. But beware of imitation tanka paintings and Peshmina shawls. Best place to buy tanka paintings and Peshmina shawls is at the patan square
Thamel. Best for stop and relax.visited massage centre and it's very good.good restaurent and we love eating steak at thamel area.

Best shopping spree, fun place to walk around . I say this because I totally love art, craft and all the colorful wonderful things people make! Thamel is buzzing with stuff to buy. Food is good but not great, though there are plenty of options that might suit different tastes. We spent every evening hanging out here.
Experience Thamel. Best place for shopping,relax and for night clubs.It's the perfect place who people who have been starved of shopping for any period of time.

City within a city. A small world in the centre of the city where you get everything at every possible prices. You can spend penny or thousands. You can stay for hours or days as per your convenience. Its a place where you can enjoy as per your budget.

More to Thamel than shops.. Whilst ever tourist that lands at Katmandu airport more than likely ends up in Thamel, it takes a day or so of wandering around to realise that beyond the shops and the touts wanting to sell you anything, the side pictures of this area are the things I enjoy the most. I love going down the narrow streets and laneways, getting glimpses of the locals life's as they go about their daily routine. Colour ,sights and smells greet your senses as you discover things such as the old English cemetery, the numerous mini temples ,statues and location stores, selling what they need , not what we want.Some of my favourite images are from these walks and each time I go back and show new people this part of Thamel.Of corse if you just want to shop then Thamel is the place for you. Look , price and compared and when you decide on what you want, haggle for a better price but remember to be respectful. If you can't find common ground then move on saying thank you.Thamel has no end of places to eat , be careful of the hidden cost, the tax they add on after so always look to see if it included in the price or an add on.For me Thamel is a great place to recover from the rigours of the trek that you have just finished, but Igor me 2-3 days is about all I can do. Other places beckon if I've got more time.

"Tourist Attraction". Tourist District. I'm not a fan of Thamel. I would not have enjoyed staying there but it is definitely good for someone wanting the party scene. I think it's safe to say that everything in Thamel is more expensive than nearly anywhere else in Nepal, simply because its main audience is tourists and they are always busy. Definitely check it out. If you're in Thamel, go to Mandala Street. It's a no driving street so it's a lot less busy.

vast variety of vegetables and fruit. when we strolled through the lanes of Kathmandu i was very surprised of the wide variety of vegetables and fruits which are available, at the roadside shops.most of them are homegrown and sold for a living. i bought back some chilies , the seeds i planted on my balcony and they are sprouting already ( the small & round variety ) the mangoes are a must try during this season.
Quaint city. Best French Bakery in Thamel! Also an awesome store that supports helpless girls by teaching them hand- crafts! Be sure to visit!

Thamel.... the walking street. You name it and you have it. best restaurants, pubs, disco, lounges, curio shops, trekking gears and everything one can think of. no trip to Nepal is complete without spending time at Thamel, this places changes it colour according to the time of the day and is awesome from dawn to midnight

Exciting, interesting . Thamel is a really cool, bustling city with many attractions in shops and eateries. The people are lovely, though always keep aware. There are many great places to explore and although it's easy to get lost in the winding streets, it's also very fun.

Just WalkIn to the streets of Thamel..!!. Thamel is the best place for travellers to stay in Kathmandu. It has replaced the famous freak street as the main hangout for backpackers and these days it's full of cafes, restaurants, hotels and shops catering to tourists. It´s very practical to stay there as you can find most of the shops with maps, outdoor gear, books and other things you might need for the trip there. I would really advice people to also visit other parts of Kathmandu though as you can otherwise come away with the impression that Kathmandu is just one big tourist place and it is not at all. Many parts of Kathmandu sees very few foreigners and these parts are nice to visit too even if they have less cafes than Thamel.

Busy Busy area!. The tourist area of Thamel with its many vendors, shops cafes and people!! The roads are narrow, the cars and scooter are many and the people are everywhere. If not from busy city can be sensory overload! Many nice hostels are located in this area. No street signs so can get lost in the maze of streets and buildings

Great for wandering the streets and getting lost. We tried to do the walking tours listed in lonely planet and even with local help we were unsuccessful. That being said we had a great time wandering around. I highly recommend the Asian tole area where the market is, especially if you want colorful pictures.

Too awesome streets.. The most beautiful streets Of Kathmandu are of Thamel. When you visit Kathmandu walking in the streets of Thamel is must. Different shopping complexes and shops are available there. My personal experience I purchased very beautiful paintings at a very reasonable rates from one shop in Jyatha Thamel(Kaulica Arts)and then had yummy food at Kilroys restaurant near the shop.

Be alert, be very alert. I loved walking around Thamel but it takes some getting used to. There are tons of people, some cars, a lot of rickshaws, a billion mopeds, and 2 billion motorcycles... It is crazy. That being said there are also great places to e at and shop and people watch.

“Hustle & Bustle”. Thamel area is a typical tourist area. You can find shops selling climbing gear, books, handicrafts etc.Feel free to bargain heavily - atleast 40 -50 % of starting prices. Many jewelry stores but I was not certain of the authenticiy of gems and value of jewelry. Know your merchandise before buying The hawkers are somewhat assertive.You watch where you go, as pot-hole and uneven pavement can trip you. Colourful busy streets, packed with shops and cafes. Lots of good places to eat and buy 'genuine fake' outdoor gear - good for clothes like down jackets and fleeces. Every kind of food you could hope to find. Lots of souvenir, book, map and craft shops. Bustling, and a great place to potter about.

Very touristy. A cheap place to eat and stay in and the locals are nice enough. I went when it was dry season = no electricity. Also, there is that fuel shortage so ouch! Compact and perhaps slightly confusing at first, it is still an ok place- very touristy of course
Visit heaven trek. I love this place ,many shop with cheap price and the peoples is very friendly. The most important is very cheap hehehe...

The place to stay at KTM. If you want to be on a walking distance to cafes, bars, restaurants, shops and even the temples of the city center, this is the right place to stay. The streets are narrow but vibrant.
A Visual Delight..... Love Thamel , never get sick of walking the walk...packed with visual delights , culinary treats and enticing eateries and bars , all I can say is ENJOY ....

Overrated. Thamel is a pretty tacky tourist-trap. However - compared to most tourist-traps around the world, the quality of what's for sale is relatively good in an overall sense. It's still quite smelly & grotty - but much less so than all of its Kathmandu surrounds. A little perilous as a pedestrian - don't move sideways suddenly, you may end up in the gutter having been side-swiped by a motorbike. You should venture a visit there - but be prepared to be underwhelmed.

Best place to shop in Kathmandu!. I highly recommend that you do all of your shopping here in Thamel rather than any other places in Kathmandu. I find sellers here reasonable and would lean in to bargaining. All of the items I bought from other areas were all found here as well! I then realized that I could have done all of my shopping in one area!Please note, you go around by walking and taxis are uncommon.
Ok . The thamel me and my family been in this palace call thamel is really good for shopping also enjoy far training

Great place to walk around.. Great place for shopping for trinkets, fake northface/trekking gear and cashmire items. Lots of good restaurants and hotels/hostels/guest houses. Many travel agents for trekking and sight seeing. Feels very safe.

Shopping Area. Thamel is an area which is a tourist place are arounded. Many hotel and restaurant along the road and block street. So many outdoor shops and also travel agent, money changer, and others souvenirs shops. This is a right place for tourists to stay.
Good place to see a lot of things. Very nice and busy area to stroll around for food and shopping. Also nice hotelarea with rooftops here and there with views over Kathmandu.

Best destination for shopping and real Nepali taste around Thamel for short day tourist. Thamel is a commercial neighborhood in Kathmandu, the capital of Nepal. Thamel has been the center of the tourist industry in Kathmandu for over four decades, starting from the hippie days when many artists came to Nepal and spent weeks in Thamel. Even though Thamel has been referred to as a "ghetto" by some, many low-budget travellers consider it a hotspot for tourism.Country NepalCity KathmanduLanguage Official NepaliTime Zone Nepal Time Zone (UTC+05:45)Co-ordinates 27.714771, 85.311391Thamel is distinguished by its narrow alleys crowded with various shops and vendors. Commonly sold goods include food, fresh vegetables/fruits, pastries, trekking gear, walking gear, music, DVDs, handicrafts, souvenirs, woolens, clothes. Travel agencies, small grocery stores, budget hotels and restaurants also line the streets. Cars, cycles rickshaws, two-wheelers and taxis ply these narrow streets alongside hundreds of pedestrians.There are many restaurants in Thamel that serve traditional and continental cuisine, although prices are significantly higher than in non-tourist areas. Thamel also acts as the pre-base camp for mountaineers. It boasts a wide range of mountaineering gear shops, foreign money exchange booths, mobile phone shops, pubs, clubs, and nightlife along with the numerous travel agents and guest houses. Thamel is home to a wide range of the Nepalese population, and serves both entertainment and employment purposes.Source: WIKIPEDIA

It's touristy but there are still some great local places. Thamel is like so many places around, a city trying to adapt to tourists and attract much needed tourism.I normally try to stay in places that are less touristy but was traveling with friends with kids and Thamel made an easy staging point for our pending trek.Like any developing country you'll have people in the streets trying to sell you all kind of things (and not all legal) but it's totally safe, those that want luxuries can find them and if you want to stay at a inexpensive hotel and eat $1.50 meals with the locals then you can do that as well.I'm sure I'll be back one day, if only to visit Sam's Bar.

The main tourist attraction . Thamel has been the center of the tourist industry in Kathmandu for over four decades, starting from the hippie days when many artists came to Nepal and spent weeks in Thamel.
shopping & eating paradise. a large number of good reasonably priced restaurants. great variety for shoppers. the whole of thamel is geared for the tourist.

Too awesome streets . When you visit Nepal,Kathmandu. Don't forget to move in the streets of Thamel. The streets of Thamel are so beautiful. There you can Shop anything. Full of different different shops. Clothing, art galleries, handicrafts, restaurants etc. Personally, I went to this Shop art gallery named(Kaulica Arts)In Jhyatha, I got paintings and thankas at a very reasonable price.The streets are although full of people but its still worth to go. People who apply Heena on your hands are also there. Good luck !
Most Happening Place in Kathmandu. You get everything here as a tourist. All kind of hotels, ample good places to eat, nightlife. It is the place to stay if you are in Kathmandu
love to back again and again. Its not first time to visit thamel. I have visited last year and cant forget good time all around...
"Muddy road and loud music". For shopping is good you can find lots of restaurants like road house ,third eye but road is muddy and very hard for walk and loud music.
Tourist centre. It's a good place to be based, and if you like looking round tourist shops it's wonderful. But a great range of hotels and restaurants and access to many sites.

Shopping and cultural fusion . A place where one can learn and sharpen haggling skills. This area offers plenty of things for everybody. Food in variety ranging from local Nepali to international cusines. Yoga, massage parlors, art galleries, cafetaria's bars and pubs suiting all pockets. Busy area good for walking .
Awesome. Awesome place to hang around and to get the essence and beauty of true Nepal. I have rarely seen a colorful street like which Thamel has.

Too many the same. Thamel is a must as it is just funny to walk around there and see the many small shopes with garments and handicraft. Annoying is that each and every seller wants to speak with you for hours even when you just dare to look a second in his shop. they should really stop doing that. Prices are reasonable but start with around 30% of what they ask you. Some are really overasking!

The very busy popular dowtown. THAMEL. KATHMANDU. North to Durbar sq., and near to the tiny Dreams of Garden. 5 km or 30' to the airport. Narrow streets, with every kind of shops (souvenirs), fruts, agencies, Hotels (Friends Home, in the South), restaurants, rickshaws (150 R is good to transport until Durbar o similar distance). and you will have a nice memory of this cheap and scenic trip.

What can one say?. Thamel has grown to supply the needs of one or two particular types of tourist ... Trekkers and backpackers. Almost every shop sells either trekking clothes or cheap Nepali crafts and clothes. I found it hard to believe that such a mountain of goods could be made by cottage industries. I was amazed to see "100% Pashminas" hanging in the streets and piled high on the shelves in the shops. Tons of brass Buddhas and prayer wheels. Reams of craft made paper and thousands of Thankas and greeting cards. Restaurants and clubs were mostly western style or fusion. I found some interesting and some left me wondering if I were, indeed, in a foreign country. Hotels have grown in profusion. I chose not to visit bars that offered dancing.Pilgrims Book House is cavernous and a great place to sit out the rains.Thamel, in my opinion, is just a place to find reasonable accommodation at a reasonable price. It is also a good base to arrange tours from. I thought it lacked charm, although there were places of interest hidden in courtyards (cafes, temples etc). We all have different needs and expectations ... For me, staying in Thamel was a disappointing experience.

Hold on to your wallet! . In Thamel you need to hold on to your wallet not because something will happen to it but because there is just so much to attract the eye. You'll have a hard time deciding what NOT to buy. There are good quality goods, like Pashmira shawls and singing bowls, and lots of every kind of jewelry, clothes, bags, rugs, etc. etc. Of course bargaining is part of the game. Or you can just feast your eyes on the multitude of colors.

great place for nightlife. walking around Thamel in the night is great experience and I love to recommend all to spent time here. The bar and cafes are really nice and hanging in clubs around Thamel gives you much fun!
Great place to stay.. Its the place to shop and eat, fantastic restaurants, lots of shops. Lots of good people to help you with your visit.

Organized Chaos . Chaos awaits you .. Just about anything you can think of from this area of the world. You can also find lots of coffee and tea shops as well as cafes to eat. Certainly a good place to people watch for sure!

Market place to find every damn thing. One downside....people who sell so called 'maal', who literally irritated and bothered alot. Too much bargaining... too much options.For decent couples, try to find hotels out of thamel and come here only for shopping. Hotels pubs and all...you can find anything and everythin to x to z...if you know what i mean.

Most bad and a little good. Thamel is a very vibrant place! A lot of shops, bars and restaurants to suit any taste. The people in Thamel are mostly terrible. Tourists are fine, but with me being a white, female traveling alone, I was hassled beyond sanity, I was touched and I was stalked and threatened. I don't know if it's different when you're traveling with a group, but I felt very uncomfortable to leave my hotel to be honest. I enjoyed the shopping and bought some fantastic items, but that doesn't outweigh the way I was treated
Street shopping. If you like bargaining and Street shopping, then this is a must visit for woolen clothes, jackets, stones and olden collectibles.

A vibrant place. It is a wonderful experience to hang out and shop in the vibrat area of Thamel. Shopping is a pleasure here. Go ahead use your bargaining skills for a satisfying purchase that you can take back home nd cherish. I particularly liked the Yak wool stuff which is unique to this place.

Crazy muddy cool Thamel. Let's be honest- this whole district is a dive and a tourist trap. However, there are some cool bars and cafes, and you can buy tourist-oriented items (from serious name-brand trekking gear to local handicrafts, stationery, tie-dyed shirts and Buddhist prayer bowls). After dark you'll be offered hashish and other temptations, but it seems generally safe. It's a little less overwhelming for westerners than the authentic local markets which are even dirtier and more chaotic. Housing ranges from hostels to fairly nice boutique hotels. Despite the compact size of the city, I would recommend hiring a driver or taxi if you leave the Thamel district, and there is no way I would rent a car here, but with some mud-resistant shoes Thamel is very walkable.

A must when visiting Kathmandu. This part of Kathmandu have everything from historical places to tourist shops. In addition if you take some smaller streets you will see the ordinary life of the Nepalese people. Still a lot to reconstruct after the earthquake in 2015 so lets hope the tourists are coming and improve the economy of Nepal.

Tourist capital. Walking distance to durbar square and in the heart of everything. Very touristy which has pros and cons obviously. For my first trip to nepal it was good having everything close by though.
Restaurants, bars and shopping.. Busy place with lot's of restaurants, bars & shops. It's best to get an accommodation in this area for easy access.

Great Area of Kathmandu. Thamel seems like the center of the city. Filled with great restaurants and wonderful shops. My suggestion is for you to stay in the Thamel area. Close to everything you will want to see and experience

Shopping, Shopping, Shopping.... This a great place to shop for just about anything that Kathmandu is known for. Walk around and you will either find it, or someone will walk up to you and ask if you would like to buy it... great experience

A typical bazaar full of Nepali stuff. This is a great place to check out for cheap shopping, if you're not intimidated by crowds, traffic, pollution, vendors hassling you, you hassling the vendors. Most things you see are the same 4 stores repeating - sports and camping gear (fake name brands), shawls and sari's, clothing and decor/souvenirs, with some other shops sprinkled in, like jewelry, regular shoes/clothes, some food and massage places. I suggest taking a look around first, but you won't have to go far if you're looking for one of the above things. Haggle, haggle, haggle, and don't pay over 1/3 to 1/4 of the original price. Multiple items will get a deeper discount, although I likes giving by business to multiple shops rather than one. It's a unique experience if you're new to Asia, be prepared to be overwhelmed and your senses entertained. Bring water, and enjoy the experience.

well place for tousits and local handicrafts and all shopping for traditional arets and crafts of nepalese tradition. The place is crowdy where you can see the tourists round from the global visinting thamel. Here the builings and premises you will find of true nepalese ancient type and all.
Crazy Place with Everything you Need Before and After Your Trek!. A crazy maze of narrow streets with lots of shops and restaurants. Plenty of hotels in the area! Great part of Kathmandu experience.

Full on. A busy full on place to visit, lots of shops bar restaurants, lots of locals approaching me to sell me anything they have , from local jewlery and instruments to drugs and sex, it is not seedy, but as the low season you will get hassled, The best defense was to speak the few words of german I knew and no english as they none of the locals have yet learnt german, so soon gave up, but as soon as I spoke english they would follow me for a bit, It is worth a visit and great for shopping , but be prepared, then there is also the cars, motorbikes, bike, dogs and the odd cow zooming around you, Go for the experience and stay chilled and relaxed,At the end of the day everyone is trying to earn the money to buy the food and pay the bill like the rest of us

I'm not a shopper, but this was amazing!. An amazing mix of food (they have momo's everywhere), clothing shops, curios, tradesman shops, coffee, tea, and temples. Make sure you get a map and leave crumbs, especially at night when the lights go down and landmarks disappear. But really well worth the adventure

Fun & definitely worth a visit . Visiting kathmandu without having walked through thamel is like breakfast without coffee. You can do it but to get the full experience it is worth to walk around for a bit in this busy area, enjoy a beer or dinner at a rooftop and visit some shops!

Authentic Local Shopping. The place is truly quality for local Nepalese shopping. The shops are closely situated with intermittent hotels, cafes, bars, restaurants. While you are walking around choosing stuff to buy you are also going to enjoy the breaks of food, drinks and coffee you could grab all along.
Awesome Thamel. Bought a lot of cheap things in Thamel. Mostly trekking accessories. The place is truly a shopping wonderland. I just can't get enough of it!:D
Thamel is alright. Thamel is the tourist epicenter of Kathmandu. Street vendors upcharge, rickshaws follow you, etc etc. but it's nice as long as you can bargain and know how to say No.
Busy trekking shopping. Lots of stores selling counterfeit (and real) trekking gear. Also other touristy stuff like scarves, massages and bookstores. Great if you're missing something for a hike

Great Shopping. We stayed in Thamel a couple of days prior to and after our trek to Everest Base Camp. It literally has everything you can imagine in terms trekking gear if you are looking for that last minute item. If you are shopping for souvenirs, this area has endless stores selling all the same things, so you can bargain for a good deal. The sites, sounds, colors and smells make it great for an afternoon of just walking around.

Interesting . Thamel is a place catering to budget travellers to Nepal with cheap hotels, bars, souvenirs stores and so on. Calm during the day and wild at night. It totally depends on what you want to do. There are nice restaurants for the evening meals with family, bars to hang out with friends, live music playing at certain places, discotheques running till late night. On the contrary there is also the shady dance bars serving overpriced everything with a disgusting atmosphere and touts trying to sell drugs on the streets. However, all in all it's a great place to be in while in kathmandu.
Too crowded and dusty. It is way too crowded and dusty to enjoy a good nice stroll in the city. It is easy to get lost as well!
very nice. Thamel is good place to be while you are in nepal. you can find different type of restaurant, travel agency, shopping and night club
Crowded . A big no for thamel. There is no space in streets to move freely. In evening you'll face number of touts offering you dance bar or massage parlour services keep away from them.

Very western. Thamel is definitely the place to do your souvenir and gift shopping in Kathmandu, but has the atmosphere of being a bit of a tourist trap or ghetto. There are bargains to be had, and most vendors are open to friendly bartering. Food is slightly more expensive in Thamel than other parts of the city, the plus side being that restaurants are mostly very clean and geared to westerners. It's definitely worth a visit, especially for a shopping trip, but be prepared to stray from this neighbourhood as it's the least 'authentic' neighbourhood in Kathmandu.

The Crazy Thamel ..... Thamel is interesting, is hectic, is crazy, is noisy, is crowded and you cannot say you’ve really been to Kathmandu unless you at least passed through Thamel…Thamel is an area of Kathmandu where tourists much outnumber the locals and where perhaps 90% of the tourist population resides. Almost every building seems to have a shop or a restaurant at the street level, there are a few guesthouses on every block, a travel agency and an exchange office in every other building. Its very narrow streets remained the same for almost a century while Thamel grew exponentially and nowadays you would at any time share the street with a push rickshaw, two motor rickshaws, three motor bikes, a few push bikes and one or two cars, plus pedestrians, all at the same time, something it would be impossible to visualize … This is the place to arrange or finalize all your transportation and trekking needs, buy an endless variety of handicrafts, especially thangkas, pashmina shawls and garments, everything you may need for your upcoming trek, all kind of books on mountaineering, spiritualism, religions and the occult, music, maps of all kinds, mani stones, tiger balm, curios and so much more……The food options include Nepali, Tibetan, French, Italian, Chinese, Korean, Israeli and more and, function of what nationality has the largest share of tourists at the moment, you would see ads in Italian, Hebrew or Chinese… You may get tired of all the crowed and the noise after a few days here, but in a few months after you're back home you may start missing it ...
Crazy. Kathmandu is colourful, loud and intense but it is definitely worth a visit - the food is great and there is so much to look at - make sure you venture out of the tourist areas!

Good for gifts and handicrafts . A bit crowded and narrow but full of shops to get any souvenirs and at the cheapest prices we found as long as you were able to haggle... As a general guide, most things went down to about half the 'best price' offered.

Good for pretrek shopping . It is good for do shopping before your trekking. You can find everything for your trip, A to Z.It has different atmosphere than Kathmandu. Tourist place. But little crowded and street sellers sometimes bother you. And evening noisy. We prefer to stay next to airport and used taxi to go thamel for shopping. I think that was good choice.

Shop local and dodge the traffic . An excellent experience to see local shopping, produce and great places to eat. It's an experience walking the side streets and taking on the traffic in any direction. Cars, stalls and people fill the narrow streets, yet the chaos almost feels non chaotic. Everyone is polite, even the cars battling out head to head. Wear good shoes, the roads, paths and rubble is not so good in thongs. Also negotiate your price.... There was a variance of $50 AUD for exactly the same cashmere blanket!

A good place for food and music.. Its one of the famous streets in Kathmandu for good food from wide variety of restaurants. You can find good pubs and bars with very good music. Also a great place for shopping for tourist.

Suitable for all kinds of tourists. Very attractive places for tourists. you can find almost everything including hotels, restaurants, shops, amusements in one place. Don't bother if you are not seeking for star studded hotels. Roads are bit congested though.
Nice district!. Lovely restaurants, clubs, live music, good food, lots of shops, dogs, cows and so many friendly people!!!

Thamel shoppers paradise. We stayed in thamel just tn before en and after our EBC trekking . Nice place to shop for trekking gear. Cheap and lot of options have to bargain . Start at 50% of the price they quote.

Psychotically Chaotic but Interesting . Tangles of wires and rubble abound but it's a great place to buy anything you need for day trips or trekking. There are better places to go, but if you're in Kathmandu more than a day you will likely find yourself walking the crazy streets of the thamel!

Best for shopping Arts , culture and trekkers. Thamel is one of the best shopping area for arts, antiques , clothings and equipments for trekkers. Easy to find difference kinds of restaurants , budget hotels. it's the place that make you enjoy everyday.
