Vibrant. Think of something to shop and its already there in Thamel.Such a colorful and vibrant place that one would never feel to miss in a visit.Once u leave the place, you mind still pulls to Thamel
Bustling and busy. Great place to wander, you will find everything you need here, but get off the main street and explore the temples

Busy!. This is really the backpackers and tourist part of town with plenty of shops and street hawkers trying to sell their wares. A great place to wander and have a few drinks and a bite to eat.....as well as pick up a bargain!

Interesting area. There's so many things to shop! Great place to shop for outdoorsy things! Bought a local-made blouse, looks good on me and price is cheap too! Rickshaw was a bit pricey but because it's gas free and my rickshaw guy cycled all the way, I didn't mind paying extra.

interesting and bustling place. We stayed here for quite a few days. the place is mad, busy, full of market stalls, pubs, bars, shops and restaurants. A must visit if you go to Nepal.
There are plenty of gifts to bring home to friends and family and bartering with the shopkeepers is essential. I got a few lovely Yak wool scarves and lovely handbags.

I was at a very wrong time due to political problems and short of supplies in Nepal.. Nepal is a nice friendly country but too much of political problem effecting tourism. Hope it is much better in good times.

Tourist section of Kathmandu. Nice hotels in this area, lots of souvenir stands. Can easily get lost if you don't memorize higher signs, all the stands and corners look the same. Lots of trinkets for sale.

Tourist hub full of life. Useful but crowded. Thamel generates mixed memories in my mind when I look back two weeks after the visit. On one hand, it has rich variety of eateries, memento shops and shops for all things related to trekking, hiking or mountaineering. On the other, it has also some shady looking joints and amongst crowds, you can easily spot actions which make you uncomfortable. After weighing the two also, I would strongly recommend a visitor to go to Thamel and feel Kathmandu life first hand,

Touristy shopping area. The place to go get your souvenirs, but souvenirs you must get. Contribute to the Nepalese economy to help them recover from the recent earthquakes. I bought stuff from organic teas to yak soap and blankets, to hemp bags. They made lovely gifts for my family and friends!

Crowded Thamel!. For people visiting KTM is a must, the street offer some nice cafes, hotels, markets specially to buy fabric related products, some nice healing centers, some of the bars and restaurants are really good.Night us the best time to visit Thamel!
horrible tourist hub. though you can stay the night in Bouddha, many tourists and up in Thamel, noisy, stinky, absolutely to be avoided

Great place to shop and eat. Lots of shops and restaurants as well as bars. We were here for 7 nights so we went to various eating places and never had a bad meal. Lots of shops so plenty of choice for presents. You can barter in all of the shops.

good for walking shopping. Good for Shoppingfind any kind of handcrafts,trekking shops, good price but look at least 3 different shop for price stabilisation:-)Find the Kala PAtther Storr (the best price there)a lot of restaurant and cooffee shops stop and eat and enjoy with coffe and tea...go to map,bookpostcard shop ,the best according to me was "Map Centre"

Fun and fabulous shopping!. A great range of goods and gifts - all in one easy to access location. Bargain hard - but staypolite and friendly. Nepalese are lovely people. And be prepared to be offered tiger balm and a wooden flute multiple times each day!

Chaos. It seems quite confronting to nearly be killed every couple of minutes while walking around here!! You get used to it after a couple of hours. The shopping is quite varied and dont be afraid to try the local sport haggleing!!

Friendly Thamel. Thames is easy to get around whether you choose to walk bike or other means shopping is great and the locals are very friendly and don't pressure you to much to buy unlike Bali or Vietnam . They are also very honest and helpful this is a very safe country to visit and the locals are only to Eagar to please . Eating out is fantastic and there are many good restaurants to choose from prices are similar but do vary the more western style a little more expensive but still cheap compared to AUS .

Strolling along Kathmandu's tourist heart!. "Thamel" has been the very tourist heart of Kathmandu for more than four decades! The first hippies arriving in Kathmandu chose "Thamel" (and its narrow and bustling streets) as their home while in town! "Thamel" keeps up its tradition as an important commercial area, where one can find almost anything needed: from simple postcards to mountain trekking items! Restaurants and hotels are spread along the neighborhood. Located at a mere 15-20 minute walk from Kathmandu's center, "Thamel" bravely survived - largely undamaged - the terrible earthquake that devastated Kathmandu on April 25, 2015. So, if visiting Nepal is on your plans, please keep up your schedule. Visiting Nepal is a form of supporting the country's reconstruction efforts. Enjoy!

Omg I just love this place. I am not hippie but I love this place. I know that this is kind of artificial enclave in Kathmandu, that it's not true Nepal and it's extensive compare to other places but you'll find there everything a traveller might need. You can buy everything there, from souvenirs to trekking gear, Nepali snacks and even they can fix your worn shoe! Just remember to bargain! Easy? Easy! The restaurants offer cuisines from around the globe. If you have had enough dal bhat go and have a steak or Italian pizza or maybe some Chinese noodles. You'll have live music there, bars with happy hours. If you need porter, a trip or a plane or bus ticket you can find someone to help you with that! Just everything! You can easily live there without leaving this place :)
Busy and bustling. It is a good place to immerse yourself into the Kathmandu culture. Shops and food outlets surrounding narrow alleyways. The place has a unique charm to it

Tourist ghetto. Really crowded tourist ghetto. Allmost every price are atleast twice as high as normal prices in kathmandu. Easy to find everything you need, from trekking gear to khukuris. Really many People offers drugs and other illegal substances through the Day.

Everything you need as a tourist. This is the place to be to get everything you need before trekking (guides, sleeping bags, mittens, etc), and to relax and plan your next stop once you've come down off the mountain. It's narrow streets dazzle with historical details and you just can't get enough of the shrines on every corner and the tiny doors with elaborately carved sills and shutters. You can almost feel history built up around you. But be sure you stray out of Thamel into the surrounding neighbourhoods to get a balanced view of life in Kathmandu.

Lots of Rickshaws, Narrow Streets Filled w/ Everything!. It's a busy place - lots of shops selling trekking gear, Himalayan clothing, knives and anything else one could possibly want to find. Rickshaws are all over - lots of markets spilling into the streets. Buddha's Eyes are on every corner.

Lively Thamel!. This place is located in central Kathmandu area and the place is a hub for all the shoppers, monument visitors, shopping malls and Nightlife.The area has very close proximity to all the Casino as well. The area is always crowded with foreigners who want to shop good and cheap products of Nepal. This place is also known as the main center for trekking Himalayas as all the travel gears and travel facility is available from this place.The area has one of the best and affordable Hotels with amazing food and a nearby electronics market. One can even book for a trip to Pokhara and other parts of Nepal easily from this area. Even a day travel to Kathmandu's monuments and temples can be booked here.Overall, the best place to stay at Kathmandu.
Busy & Noisy. Be careful when you walk at the side of the road.The streets are narrow and dusty.Along the road there were many shops selling pashmina, trekking gear etc.

Color, Character, and Chaos -- a beautiful work of art!. I LOVED THAMEL! In spite of having to dodge taxis and motorcyles on narrow streets, I love spending time in the Thamel District. On my most recent trip, I became much more relaxed and found the merchants to be engaging and interactive, probably because I learned to enjoy the process. The colors and smells in the district are unbelievable, and the merchandise is as varied as you can find anywhere. I loved coming across hidden tea rooms and pizza parlors, and finding New Orleans in a courtyard was just a welcome piece of Southern hospitality for this southern girl from Mississippi. I've stayed in other areas of Kathmandu, but I really liked our quiet oasis on the edge of Thamel. Can't wait to go again!

tiresome place without real advantages. thamel is a tourist district mostly emptied out of its local charm: full of shops and locals approaching you to spend your money at them. one day is enough to check it out. all the fuss and there is nothing behind it, unlike in venice for example. overpriced touristy restaurants and hotels where you can't sleep from.the noise.i recommend to see other districts, even the nearby durbar square, for somr real experience.

Nice Tourist place. Where we was staying easy to move one place to another friendly people, nice shops around it lots of budget hotels around it. Though its little bit dirty but it's a getaway to move all over the Nepal.

Must visit place for tourists in Kathmandu. It is a place you cannot miss to visit in Kathmandu. It has all shops, restaurants that you would need, be it to prepare for hiking, trekking or just to buy sovereign items from one of the handicraft shops. Thamel also has got plenty of budget to mid range hotels and ideal place to stay.
You haven't been to Kathmandu unless you've been to Thamel. Restaurants, shops, walking vendors, crazy traffic and the occasional cow. Can be mayhem, but that's what makes it so interesting.

Dirty quite boring really. Dirty, you would never believe the main street is the main street of a country's capital city. Stuff to buy is pretty identical to all the other shops...prices are high...need to bargain by around 50%. Dangerous street far too much traffic to wander around in a carefree manner. There are some great places to eat though in centre if you check tripadvisor reviews!

As Colorful As Ever. I was pleasantly surprised to find Thamel remained vibrant and colorful after the earthquake. You could walk around the streets and hardly found any sign of destructions. The people are friendly and not overly pushy although life is hard after the quake. You could shop at your own comfort. I love to feast my eyes on the lovely pashminas and all sorts of unique knicks knacks. Excellent choice of traditional and international restaurants. Most of the badly affected areas are located on the outskirts of Kathmandu. Thamel is still the same old, vibrant Thamel like I first visited 3 years ago. I travelled solo and felt safe throughout my stay there.

Tourist and trekker haven. Thamel is the shopping district of Kathmandu. Thronged with tourists and trekkers, it is full of shops selling all kinds of trekking gear, t-shirts, pashmina, cashmere and tea. Do beware of fake branded goods though - if a price is too good to be true, it probably is. There are many shops selling North Face bags and jackets etc. Check the product tags - if it doesn't look authentic, buyer beware. And bargain.

Trekking HQ of Kathmandu. The touristy center of Kathmandu. Very convenient as a launching point to go trekking. There are countless trekking companies (usually on the second floor of buildings) that you can just walk into to begin booking a trek. Likewise, the first story has many trekking gear outfitters that sell/rent any trekking equipment you might need. Their gear is mostly rip-offs, so I suggest not using them for critical items (e.g. shoes) but otherwise it's all perfectly fine. Also, it is much cheaper and more useful to rent equipment as opposed to buying.

Thermal the heart of Kathmandu. Vibrant exciting annoying hustle and bustle. You could be mown down by taxis, bicycles, trishaws, buses, carts going either way down the narrow streets of Thamel. You will be asked if you want a taxi/trishaw, you will be accosted by shopkeepers, moneychangers, restaurant waiters and travel agents all trying to sell you their wares. . This is a wonderful place despite all this and one of the best things you can do is sit upstairs in a cafe and watch the world go by. There are numerous shops selling, books, maps, clothes, food, trekking gear, fashion gear, fruit and vegetables, pots and pans, and restaurants and cafe's offering French, Spanish, Nepali, Indian, Italian and many other dishes.

Good place for shopping trekking's equipment. A fine place to visit and shopping for trekking's equipment. I've been walked in there for several hours, keeping compare the price between shops. Some shop offer huge discounted. Don't rush your bidding.

Kathmandu's busy tourists quarter. You like it or you don't. I think there's nothing in between. For myself I can only say I enjoy the number of little stores with their souvenirs, pashmina shawls, statues, CDs or bakeries.What Thamel stands for I found these days on a sign in the center. Nothing to add.
Overpriced and too many tourists. Too many tourists, overpriced boutiques. Non sense. Try to go in the side roads, not the Thamel main road.
A taste of Kathmandu. A bartering experience. It was nice to be able to look at goods without the feeling of pressure. You can always say no thank you. Lots of goods to buy.
Touristy. Touristy for cheap knock off stuff. It is ok, but bring your haggling skills with you. Nothing is cheap unless you can barters.

Wonderful panchase hill trek. We had great experience of panchase hill trek. This time we were afraid with recently happened earthquake in nepal that it may have damaged the route coz i am travelling with my family with 7 and 9 years kids. It was short and suitable trek for us. During the trek our guide take care us well and local tea houses offer us the wounderful hospitality. Highly recommended NTB adventures!!
Buzzing. I found Thamel very lively being the tourist area of Kathmandu. Lots of good restaurants and shops to explore.

Shopping Paradise !!!. All in one place , A-Z any thing is available at a reasonable price , hotels to stay and restaurants to eat along with a beautiful garden the Garden of dreams with an entrance fee of 200NPR.I stayed in Thamel area for 3 nights in hotel friends home , which is a wonderful hotel with fabulous service.Must visit for all age groups when you're in Kathmandu.Thanks a lot for everything ,Loving you so much,Peacefully yours.S M Bega Raaj.Happy travelling...
Thamel, shopping !. A good place for shopping, food, lodging, etc...etc....Can get SIM card for your phone too, local calls or international are much cheaper than roaming..
The beating heart of the city. A tourist magnet, many bars and hotels and shops and busy and frantic. It may seem chaotic but compared to other parts of Kathmandu, this place is easy

Tourist hub. If you want to enjoy night life in Nepal or listen some (ofter not very good) live bands, then Thamel is the place to be. Also good place to stock your equipments before trekking, or if you want to have some western food. Sadly, most of Thamel is designed to rip off foreigners who do not know the price level of Nepal. You usually end up paying too much no matter what you buy.

A Fun Place to Be. Whenever I am in Kathmandu, I always look forward to being in Thamel. There are people from every country in the world walking the streets. Great restaurants and interesting sights. You never know what you will see next.

Shop until you drop!. Always something to do, something to see, something to eat and stuff to buy! Overwhelming number of options for shopping, tons of restaurants for every budget and taste. Completely safe for walking around and watching the hustle and bustle...

Satified with the things that I bought. You can see a lot of shop in Thamel and the price is cheap. You dont need to bargain and you can get cheap but actually you can still bargain. In Thamel also a lot of cafe and bar. If you really like shopping specially outdoor gear, you come to the right place to Thamel. You also can find the real singing bowl with cheap price here. I'm happy!

What happens in Thamel should stays in Thamel??. There's a say, What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas. It might be true for Thamel too. No offense to anyone, but this nice city offers a lot of amusement. You'll find it through the city's hundreds of restaurants, bars, discos, tattoos, handicrafts, clothes, jewelries, unlimited alcohols in uncounted shops and many more... Actually Thamel is a world window at roof of the world (Nepal). Here, You'll see and meet people from all over the globe. All the races, religions and nations out there just beside you. Just one suggestion I must say, prostitution isn't legal there.But you'll face pimps. Handle them carefully. Now, why you waste your time reading this? Go, enjoy Thamel!!

Great shopping. Thamel is a great place to shop. If you do not like the price in one store, walk a little more and you will find other stores with the same item, perhaps at a better price. It has a lot of different restaurants, that offer a wide variety of food, all at great prices. If you are in Nepal for trekking, Thamel offers many shops where you can get anything you need for your trekking expedition. You will also find people from all over the world in Thamel, which is wonderful for making new friends, and enjoying great food and conversation.

Busy congested area. Thamel is famous for shopping..bars pubs disco clubs spas and tourists but this area is very congested and crowded. I came back from Nagorkot and took a hotel in Thamel and it feels very suffocating as I had stayed in a good open resort up on the hills in Nagorkot..so after that kind of experience..Thamel seems to be very crowded area to me. But it is definitely a hotspot. Everything you need as a tourist...are here.

Shopping mecca of Kathmandu. Shopping in Thamel is a mandatory part of visiting Kathmandu. But be prepared to bargain. All kinds of real and fake trekking equipment and artifacts and souvenirs are available here. Look closely though. The designer labels don't mean anything. Designer labels are stuck on everything. Don't be fooled. And enjoy the many excellent restaurants here. They are a relief from the chaos and pollution of the neighborhood. At night the many bars now offer erotic entertainment that never used to exist.

Wild Kathmandu. Thamel is a must! It is vibrant, hectically busy and you can shop until you drop. There are thousands of stores with cheaper merchandise - walking/camping gear, clothing, bags, jewellery, brass items, statues, singing bowls, music, incense - you name it, it is there. Walk the streets, but be careful - they are narrow and you will have taxis, bicycles, trucks passing by.
Loved staying in Thamel. Staying in Thamel gives you the opportunity to walk out of the door of the hotel and straight into the atmosphere of Nepal. Although very touristy, it is fun.

Heart of Kathmandu. Best nightlife activities to be found in Thamel. It is one of the hottest spot to find all range of hotels and deals. Starting from backpackers to holiday makers, Thamel has everything to offer to everyone. Enjoy the local pubs and bars with live music and multi cuisine restaurants - you can eat cheap as well as expensive depending upon what you have. Thamle is a place which allows people of all kinds to have a memorable time at Kathmandu.
Touristy but busy area . We visited here for tourist city experience it is nice area but crowed everything is invites you to visit by their goods handycarft items enjoyed here

Great area in Kathmandu. This area is super quirky and full of life. A place filled with interesting restaurants, bars and traditional shops. I believe that this is the best place to stay in Kathmandu because the hotels here are very nice and cater for all types of travellers. The only problem is the pollution and the traffic, however, it is like this pretty much everywhere in Kathmandu. If you buy something don't forger to haggle since it is part of the culture here but don't haggle too much cos prices here are already quite low for western standards and people here really need to make a living.

Architectural but poor. Very busy and buzzing but lots of dirt and dust everywhere. Homeless and sick dogs everywhere, even dead rats. On the other hand there's lots of little souvenir shops, places to eat or have a drink. Very touristy place with beautiful old wooden/brick buildings. Just not exactly what I expected from a westerners point of view.

The most amazing place I've ever been . I fell in love with kathmandu and the Thamel region as soon as I arrived. It's an assault to the senses but in the best way possible. The locals do not hassle you in anyway and are the friendliest, kindest people I've ever met. Be prepared to take home double what you came with.

Great Shopping. If you are looking for a tourist place to shop in Nepal, then go to Thamel. Be sure to juggle around with pricing as this is the culture in Nepal. I bought several little gifts here. Also, there are two Himalayan coffee places that are safe and wonderful. Don't forget to visit the Fire and Ice Italian. Here Trekkers can find gear on a deal. Thamel is a tourist destination. If you do not have a tough stomach ,do not eat street food here. We did not. Alrighty, go on and visit.

Beep beep. Constant beep beep of cars and motorbikes not angry just a wee 'coming through' beep. Lots of stalls and people do approach you with offers of treks, hash and wares but actually do leave you alone after a polite no thank you. Lots of interesting shrines and the like and lots of yummy restaurants. If you're coming to Kathmandu stay here at least two nights.

different from others. Thamel street, is different from others busy market and tourist street. you can see cheap item and gift from here , but bargain the price. good to walk, and safe place for tourist to walk around. you can get the good local food and traditional gift in here. Budget hotel also can get here, but the environment is the main issue for the tourist to concern, because of the busy noise street. Must visit.

Watch for the motorbikes!. This is the most amazing area - full of shops, cars, motorbikes and people! Don't be pressurised into buying anything but take the time to be interested in the people and their lives. Can get busy with 'foreigners' but that helps to keep the shops, bars and restaurants honest!
greatest tourist destination. one of the greatest tourist destination. a place to look at when you visit kathmandu. the super big shopping complex where I enjoyed a most

Very including area but intresting streets . Forget all your information about minimum standard of streets in the world.All people and motorcycles and any other vehicles have a very thin street and all of them move between together.but there are many shopping at this area. They present all your needs ( sovanir to dresses and...)there are many Riksha for transportation as the same of Taxi. Different colours ; push you to buy some things actually.
Just smile . Super busy, super touristy, tourist prices. But just smile and enjoy the energy! :) find the light in the midst of the chaos

Seeking The Real. My impression of Nepal is seen through the lens of a very rich, spiritual heritage, one that goes back several hundred years up to the days of man like the great Milerapa, who up till now remains a great inspirer of spiritual ideals.The people of Nepal are very humble and hardworking. Kathmandu is no exception, though in Thamel, which is the hub for tourisms, where you find many westerners, longing to trek the majesty Himalayas,things are a lot more expensive, yet hotels and food are still affordable for the average tourist. Religion plays a major role in Nepal. I myself have been to a few Hindu and Buddhist temples in Kathmandu, where I met a Nepalese man named Jitendra, who helped me beyond belief.

Lively and merry place! . Thamel has always been my favourite place for hangouts. It's lively & merry place. These days its not so vibrant as it used to be but the good thing is that its getting better with time. I hope it will get its liveliness back soon.

Thamel, Kathmandu's most touristy neighbourhood. Kathmandu's most touristy part/neighbourhood, jampacked with shops, restaurants Pashmina shops, jewellery shops etc etc. Amazing! Every backpakers ultimate paradise. It is dusty, busy with people and traffic, truly horrific but also amazing to be in that husstle and busstle!
Very touristy. A busy tourist district of Kathmandu. For the real Nepalese local life experience I would recommend going out of Thamel.
Wow.. Crazy, smoky, beautiful, colorful...Thamel is an assault on the senses, it is all that is wonderful and unique about Kathmandu.

great shopping. Wander the crazy streets of Thamel and I defy you not to buy anything - when you get it home you will say why did I buy that - taxis to Thamel are really cheap and its a great place to drink eat or just shop - lots of counterfeit stuff for sale though

Street Photographers' Heaven. If you are a photographer, looking for sightseeing, or simply want to experience Nepal's beautiful chaos.. A walk in Thamel is a must for everyone who visits the capital.. What to Expect?- Narrow Streets- Old shops- Tons Colorful and Interesting corners- Urban Exploration (traveling back in time)- Super Friendly people- So many hidden gems- non-stop hustle and bustleDedicate a couple of hours not only to walk the streets of Thamel but also to stop enjoy the treasures it offers.
Amazing place. Amazing place, really atmospheric and full of interesting people. Impossible to imagine the chaos of the place

Fun!!!. Thamel is where you'll find every touristy thing you need in Nepal but I say that in a good way. It's a tourist trap but it's also the center of a lot of stuff you will want to see. There are awesome bars at night and good food everywhere. It's walking distance to a ton of restaurants and the Durbar Square (one of three in the Kathmandu valley).
Bustling. Interesting laneways and hustle and bustle of street vendors makes it a great place to explore.Keep to side of the road as cars and bikes just have their own rules.

Place to meet other travellers. Thamel is where most tourists stay when they visit Kathmandu. It is hardly surprising given its excellent facilities and it's a great place to meet other travellers. The choice of travel agents who can help you with treks, rafting, tours and almost anything you need, plus the shopping, hotels and restaurants make this a vital and busy hub.And you don't have to go far even here, down the little alleys where you find a wonderful collection of little places that locals frequent, holes in the walls that serve steaming momos and spicy Nepali tea. Thamel sustained next to no damage in the earthquakes in April and May 2015. Reinforced concrete and newer construction techniques saved most of the buildings that suffered little more than small cracks. Of course if you want to get away from other tourists, you might want to consider venturing over to Boudhanath with it's Buddhist monasteries and little guest houses.

Variegated, multicolored..... If there is a place in Kathmandu where you can find anything you want, that's Thamel. Some people says that is just a place for turists and foreigners, but we found out that is much more than that. We love its tiny and narrow alleys, the spice flavours popping out from its stalls, the profusion of colors everywhere...Thamel is a place where u will feel in and out of Nepal at the same time...

A great experience.. What a fantastic place to shop and meet some interesting locals. Markets and bargains are everywhere and plenty of fun bargaining on the prices. Always felt safe and all the locals were very friendly. Bring an open mind and some patience!
A paradise in kathmandu. A tourist paradise for all budgets. Lots of restaurants,shops,guest houses, pubs, trekking and travel offices.

Thamel - dustier & crowded than 10 years ago. But still a bargain.. Thamel has changed in the 10 years I have visited since... more crowded and very very dusty. Nobody bothers travellers ... no pesky hawkers or beggars. Tanka shops abound. Bargains for good versions can be as low as Rs 2000.

Such a cool place!. I always feel like I have arrived home when I hit the streets of Kathmandu, and Thamel seems to be the heart of the tourist area. Bustling streets, filled with travelers, climbers and locals, all heading out to some outstanding restaurants and fun shopping.

Great Shopping. Thamel is the tourist centre of Kathmandu. It is filled with shops, restaurants and bars for tourists, but there is something quintessentially Kathmandu about it. It's busy and always bustling. You can pick up any souvenir imaginable here. There are also a huge number of outdoor shops, which make it a great place to pick up gear before trekking, or to stock up on cheap gear to bring home.
Thamel Night Life. Very Good Place for the Nightlife, Food, Shopping, etc.. There excellent hotels to stay & good restaurants.

Great but crowded . Thamel, the most happening town in Kathmandu is great place to hangout but however too many vehicle and rikshwa on street and the electric wires and hoarding boards makes it ugly. The concern department should work on this and make Thamel a best hub and revive its beauty!
Gem of Nepal. This little town in Kathmandu, has lots of handy crafts, real gem of Nepal. You can find lots of very attractive gifts for your loved one with very reasonable price.
just for shoppers ;-). its not kathmandus prettiest place, but if you need something they have a lot of fixed - price supermarket. and for shoppers it must be nepali - heaven :-)

Touristy and expensive, but lots of good places to see!. This is where you come for Kathmandu night life. Ibyza is by far the best place to club. Loads of shops trying to sell you the standard Nepali souvenirs, you can get great prices if you can barter well and stick to the price you want to pay. Loads of fun.
Trip. Nice place for souvenirs. Bargain hard, harder and hardest to get a decent price. Prices are highly inflated.

The Nepali Khan ElKhalily. A very good place for walking around and buying souvenirs, you can buy statues of Buddah and other religious stuff, I bought a Pashmina scarf for only 5 USD.. and the place also has many good restaurants including 2 offering Halal food..Across the square outside Thamel, You can find also the only 2 Mosques in Whole Kathmandu..I visited them both and prayed there..
Tourist place. Main attraction of kathmandu called tourist place Thamel. Lot of hotels, pubs, restaurant, travel and tour company can be found here.

Here is a proper Tourist Trap, but good momos to be found.. The only use for Thamel, is saving a little money on your tour guide and porter. Wait until you get to Kathmandu to book your trekking or mountaineering adventure. If you purchase it from your travel agent in your home country, you will be paying 20 to 50% more than if you come here and book it. Some have websites so you can book from home. Every other storefront is a tour company. When you book your tours, make sure that everything which is and is not included is explicitly written in your contract and itinerary. Some include all meals, some include meals but not drinks, some include breakfast, some include all meals and water but not other drinks, some don't include water. You will go through a lot of water. All prices in Nepal are 20% to 200% more for tourists, so there is always plenty of room to bargain. Also, look up the hotels or tea houses you will be staying in while on your treks. They are not all equal.
Happening place of Kathmandu. Decent hotels here, for both business and pleasure. And hence, plenty eating and shopping options as well.

Loved it.. Our hotel was situated in the heart of Thamel. It's a great walk up and down the street. Extremely crowded and 100% tourist friendly. People are nice and helpful. However, do not give in for the prices at Thamel. Nepal rips tourists off. There is a tourist price and then there is a rip off price. Make sure you bargain at every store. Local restaurants are great.

Touristic Centre of Kathmandu. A place to be when you head for trekking in Himalaya, here you can find whatever you need for trekking equipment, rest for lunch in a nice bar or go for a night drink in one of the clubs, the most touristic district of Kathmandu
Best place in Kathmandu. I loved this place, it was like my time square in Kathmandu. Everything is in here, of course is crowded but believe me it's unique.
Happening place. Its a good happening place with lot of shopping option also may restaurants, night clubs, spa etc. good place to spent time.
Shopping at Its Best. It is good for cheap shopping.All traditional things are available.Good Dance Bars open at nightGood restaurants are also there.

Beating heart of Kathmandu. The heart of Kathmandu, this is the main tourist area and is always bustling. There are plenty of narrow lanes and interesting shops selling souvenirs, plus many genuine shops for locals. It does seem that every other 'shop' is a foreign exchange!There are many, many eating options to suit every cuisine and every wallet but rather astonishingly - at least for what I expected - at night, it all becomes quite tawdry. There are neon lit bars and clubs, with smiling ladies adorning all the posters to lure you in for a 'dance' and there's thumping disco music pouring out onto the streets, creating quite a tacky, nasty atmosphere. It's going to get like Siem Reap pretty quickly. Shame.
If you have to. Busy, cramped, noisy, the heart of Kathmandu for tourists, you can find anything here but you will have to adjust

Must visit. Bargain down by 50%. You can spend hours window shopping, eating and drinking here. Whilst shopping for souvenirs suggest you check in 2-3 ships and offer 50% less in the first offer and start from there. Beware of touts and just say 'no thank you' and walk off. Don't use guides and tour chaps as they work on commissions and take you to over priced shops.
Well worth the visit. Nepal is a wonderful place to visit and the people are great. Open air shopping is just one of the many things to do.

Happening.. Happening. Thamel is sort of downtown of Kathmandu..narrow shopping streets are stuffed with restaurants, spas, bars, lounges and people!This is a nice place for those who like life in its young state.Must go if you are in Kathmandu.

Or the Trekking District. The vibrant happening part of Kathmandu with trekkers hotels/guest houses and eateries. I fear for the damage the earthquake has caused to all the people and businesses in the area. But if you are in Kathmandu the if possible support the businesses in Thamel

Thamel town . The best town to stay at kathmandu
Shops , restaurants, all you want
The people and colors of town are amazing & different !!

Nice area, look out for touts. Nice area in Kathmandu, very close to Durbar Square. Look out for a lot of touts, though they're not terribly annoying. You can buy lot's of local and traditional wares here.
Great Food & Hangout. This is a great area to stay if you are a foreigner going through Kathmandu. It is safe and there are good places to stay, good food, and lots of shopping for almost anything.

Lots to See & Do!. Thamel, Kathmandu . . . you can't miss it. It's the place where most tourist end up either for their hotel stay or shopping. Most all of the tour agencies are located in Thamel and there's lots of people pushing their tours and treks. Best to go there with plan in hand and not be taken by so many well-intentioned or not locals. I liked walking around the area and visiting the many stores. There's so much to see and enjoy. Most people are friendly enough and much of the stuff you buy is made right there in Katmandu. It's also very inexpensive. With an exchange rate of 100 rupees for $1.00 USD, it's hard not to find a bargain. Watch the traffic. It's completely annoying with taxis and scooters whizzing about in small roadways. The honking and beeping is incessant. It takes patience to get use to there nonchalant driving habits. Pedestrians DO NOT have right away as in other countries.

Crazy times in Kathmandu!. Most likely if you come to Kathmandu, Nepal you will be staying in Thamel, the tourist area. In this area you can find everything you need from food, merchadise or all kinds and hiking gear if you plan to head to the mountains. The surplus of everything is huge, with multiple shops, it's not difficult to spend a day just wandering around for bargains. It is a bit chaotic if it is your first time in Kathmandu, but you adjust very quickly to the traffic, dust and honking. Very compact area, so it only takes a few hours to know your way around the streets. Nice small supermarket stores are all around, so if you want to buy a few snacks, drinks or anything. Banks and atms are marked all over Thamel, so it's easy to withdraw at your convenience.

Tourist hangout. A great place for tourist. Some of the shops might be a little more expensive but they're convenient. Thermal has a lot of great restaurants, coffee shops, and bar/lounges. something for everyone.

Seeing Is Believing!. In July 2015, I came to Kathmandu and stayed in Thamel. Thamel is crowded but unique and pretty in its own way.Before I came, people gave negative remarks about Nepal due to earthquakes. I wrote to guesthouse owner who updated me the truth about Nepal and gave words of encouragement to visit. I am glad I came because Kathmandu is in good condition to visit and sightseeing, some temples in Durbar Square may have collapsed or cracked but still worth visiting. My family and I are having good time here. My opinion is, you can visit Nepal, the guesthouse owners or the traveling agents are friendly people to help you by all means, after all, one local people once told me, Nepal stands for "Never Ending Peace And Love". If you want to help Nepal to rebuild after earthquake, come and visit Nepal, seeing is believing, your visitation is the best support to help Nepal recovering from earthquakes.Lastly, a big thanks to Visit Heaven Treks Pvt. Ltd, the travel company in Thamel offering flexible yet professional services for us to visit Nepal. And always with a smiling face!

avoid to live there.... Kathmandu is one of the best city in the world in my opinion, apart from Thamel... crowded, touristc, expensive, without atmosphere... stay i freek street instead, or wherever else... Thamel is not Kathamandu, is just a big mess into the very nice mess of real Kathmandu...

Happening Heart of Nepal. located centrally in capital Kathmandu, Thamel has everything to offer...alcohol to food and bistro to five star property. Famous for shoppers and streets bustling with foreign tourists. A heaven for party animals. Notorious for prostitution also...

Thamel. Loved hanging around Thamel, lots of shops, bars, hotels and restaurants. Easy to get access to all. People are very friendly and helpful but only thing to watch out for drug pushes. Don't walk on your own after the shops are close, too many young guys wanted to sell drugs and young girls.

A Place for Everything You Need!. I enjoyed this place so much! Great finds, amazing food, hotels all over and friendly locals. Celebrated Christmas eve here and boy was it amazing! Live bands are everywhere, every night!

Great Place to hangout.. If you dont visit Thamel when you are in Kathmandu, you miss out on the most important part of the country.
It the hub of everything, right from the hotels, to shops, to restaurants, to travel houses, to pubs to everything. The weekends (specially Fridays and Saturdays) are fun.
This is Must visit

Tons of stuff to see in this place. All I can say is wow--in the daytime, this area is a hubbub of commotion. The sensory overload on your first day cannot be described.First, the drivers are crazy--especially the taxis. There are no traffic controls, i.e., no lights, no stop signs, no yield signs, nada--it's a free for all. But it is exciting.We stayed here for a few days before our Mt. Everest Base Camp Trek, first, in a hostel, and upon our return after our trek, in a more Westernized hotel. The reason for the change is the earthquake struck while we were on our trek. Our hostel was damaged beyond the point you could stay there, so we had to move.The people in Kathmandu, and Nepal in general, are kind, humble, and amongst the most wonderful people I've encountered in my travels. There are shops galore--and you better figure out how to negotiate prior to shopping--with excellent quality trekking knock-offs in a lot of shops. Very little is authentic here, but the quality is still good.I found the shopkeepers pleasant and on non-apparel items, excellent priced.There are so many restaurants you could eat in a different place every day for over a month I would think. But what was really a surprise is all signs were in English. This was remarkable, considering I had a hard time in South American countries since I don't speak Spanish and very little was in English. To travel to Nepal and have absolutely zero problems understanding both the signs and the people was remarkable.The Thamel section of Kathmandu is an Oasis of Commerce and I think there's problem nothing you cannot find there, if you're not concerned with authenticity. Eat out in any of the restaurants and enjoy their culture and their cuisine.I am looking forward to the day I can return.

Great place for hangout. It's happening hangout place to go around inside the Thamel with live music with all the different jazz, ragge and also blues... We can enjoy the kind of music we want and great food and drinks at a same time with nice people over.... In a walking distance of most of the places and heritage sites with oldest market called ason in few minutes walking distance...For shopping we can find malls and if you are here for work it's also easier...  Good place in every means but also we need to be smart and wiser while taking a taxi(cab) ... It's so expensive if we don't know how to bargain... Same goes for shopping....

Weekend night.. There's no any place in nepal, where you can find night clubs, bar, and pub to enjoy on weekend. Night time at thamel will sure makes you joyful. You can have a good drinks, and live music at thamel. Many of the bars, pubs, clubs gets live music on weekend. You must visit thamel. I'm sure you'll not regret.

Unusually quiet, very few travellers. I have visited Nepal many times and usually stay in Thamel at the beginning and end of trips. It is usually busy and very busy in high season (October and November) but this time. in June, there were very few visitors. June is low season because of the monsoon which usually starts around the middle of the month so I expected ot not be too busy. However, the earthquake reduced the number of travellers to Nepal dramatically.Most of the shops, restaurants, bars and souvenir shops were open and those that were closed were probably due to to a lack of business rather than the direct impact of the quake. There was some damage to buildings in the area with rubble on the streets i a few places. Overall though it was still possible to visit and enjoy Thamel and I think it will be almost back to normal in the autumn but with fewer visitors than in previous years because of the quake.

Good Place to Shop. This is a good place to shop the small items and also the gifts and souvenirs. But beware of pick pockets at some places where its too crowded. Late night shopping is not recommended.

Great area for a walk around, shoping, and a nice meal. I was in Nepal on business only, just a short trip; but with good fortune, my hotel was booked into Thamel. I had the pleasure of walking around the streets and alleys, seeing what little I could while there.I was quite impressed with the variety of shops; and also found that the shopkeepers offered fair prices without trying to gouge me (I've read reports that some have experienced this).If you have the opportunity to visit Kathmandu, you should; and when you go, make sure to plan some time to walk around and visit in Thamel.

shopping at Kathmandu. When my cab driver told me that you will get everything in Thamal, I was surprised !! But its true !!! It is not safe to spend time after 8pm when the shops are closed. It becomes paradise for illegal activities.
People from all around the world. The backpacker scenery, where you can buy crafts for 0.05 dollars or technical climbing stuff for 1.000..

A fun and colorful place. This was a fun and colorful place to walk around, prices are higher here than other areas though. Plus you'll be approached by a lot of rickshaw drivers who want to sell hash and whatnot- best to just say "no thanks" and keep walking.
I love the fresh produce that lines the streets early in the morning.
Great fun in Thamel. This is a place perfect for a coffee, a nice dinner a great shopping experience or a bohemian night out

Crowded and very colourful city center. Me and my wife came to thamel four just 5 nights. It was a wonderful experience. It was winter then. The best I liked about thamel was the shops with artifacts and silver jewelry. They ha e some amazing and mind blowing articals of silver and stones made in the Tibetan style or Buddhist style. They have also got so many of out door and indoor pubs and bars with some great live music played every evening. You can hear some great oldies in the evening and relaxing ambiance. Would love to be there again in life. Sadly after the earthquake things look disrupted a little bit.

My visit to Thamel. The place Thamel sounds love like the language Tamil in south India. Walked over Thamel and found all sorts items for tourists. Gold, Silver, brass, nice Swiss Jackets for winter (price range between $60-$300), hiking materials wonderful restaurants, Hotdog, pizza, real Nepali food, night clubs for those don't get tired, etc.,Small place but you have everything. Just be careful with your belongings.

Apartment in Thamel. Thamel is one the very few place in Kathmandu to enjoy night life. This place has many things to offer to the travelers from bars, restaurants, cafes, libraries, hotels, lodges etc. If you are moving with family members and staying for longer period there are other very cost effective solutions for getting an apartment. One of them I know is providing their own apartment which is fully furnished with most facilities. Contact him at gneeraz@gmail.com. I went with my family and its a good place to stay. There are other hotels and guest house, one of them is Kathmandu Guest House which is probably one of the oldest guest house in the place. There are many shops that displays local products and is quit different from other part of the city. Although Thamel is the only place where you will find hotels and guest house at a very short distances the place is not so crowed as compared to other local place in the city. You can easily go to any other places in the city if you are staying in Thamel because it is centrally located. Happy travel ;)

A brothel sky-opened. Thamel is the worst place in Kathmandu to visit. If you are looking for dope, women, men, children, no matter the age, as a sex mate, you will find her there. Some scenes you might be witness are a real shame. The police seem uninterested by what tourists are looking for, there. But if they decide to act, you are finding big troubles and the jails of Nepal aren't the best in the world. So, if you want to, visit the place, but be extremely careful.

Nothing wrong in Thamel . I am on a business trip to Kathmandu and I may have to stay longer for establishing my office so I had placed my own restrictions on spending . So I searched tripadvisor and noticed best reviews for a hotel and furnished apartment called Dream Hotel and Apartment for 25 US dollars including breakfast . Excellent service and fairly clean room . I spent my days and interviews in Thamel Himalayan Javo coffee shop with free internet . I did not find a decent Bar or Pub in Thamel. So I walked down to kings way and had beer in the bar of Anna Purna 5* hotel , the oldest 5* hotel in Kathmandu .

Crazy but Great. Thamel is a very busy place in Kathmandu. As are other places. We stayed there for about 13 days before moving to another location and the hotel was very nice, everywhere, restaurant and shopping wise, we wanted to go was right there and we could walk to it. Dodging cars and motorcycles on the road on the way to our destination made it actually kind of fun. I really enjoyed staying there and I will be back when we come back to Kathmandu at the end of our journey.

You can find every foreigner here and everything to enjoy in Kathmandu. If your friend is lost find him here because all the tourist in Kathmandu have unanimously decided to stay in Thamel. If you are visiting Kathmandu you will obviously be here, here you will find people from almost all nationalities in the world and food from almost all nationalities (at least the nations famous for food like Italian, French, Japanese, Thai etc hope you get the drift). You will find gazillions of bars and massage places in Thamel so good luck getting drunk and pampered. You will also find gazillions of travel agents so travelling throughout Nepal or outside Nepal will not be so much of a problem if you stay in Thamel. The rates are a bit stiff, you are tourist after all, but you can obviously bargain and also find cheap stays in this place. You can find artifacts and souvenirs which you can take back and the biggest of all you will find Khukuri's for sale :). Enjoy your stay.

Thamel. Way too crowded for me. But, I suppose a must do for most travelers at least once. Beware the cloth merchants and Pashmina sellers there is a lot of fake stuff being sold.Night time is a no go unless you want to be hustled for drugs and prostitution (dance bars with 'showers').. Not suitable for a lot of people after dark.In earlier years this place was fun, now not.

Copy Market. A touristy place. One will find all kind of people there, you think of it and you would find somebody ready to sell it to you. Most of the time you would find a copy of famous brands and it would have levels in copy category,so check before you pay.

Recovering. Thamel is recovering.There's few building collapse but mostly still stand strong.. There's few damage to the road but still manageable and our driver is very skillful driver..salute.. haha

Thamel. Nice and happening place of Kathmandu..Must visit..Quite a nightlife..But take care of your pockets..Dance bars tries to fleece money..The dancers sits beside you and asks for drink which are priced exorbitantly..take care
great place. whether you're trekking or not, Thamel is the tourist heart of Kathmandu. It's got great restaurants and great shopping. Don't miss it!
Good food, Good Ambience. It was really a great experience in being Thamel restaurant. Food quality was good and ambiance is also good. Staff is very courteous. Overall a nice place to dine.

People watching. This is the place to get your standard Western souvenirs if you must. While there are so many more worthwhile places to spend your time in the Kathmandu valley, Thamel can be worth a short visit for the people watching. A stop in Himalayan Java for coffee and momos is worth the chaos of the streets below!
Crazy but charming. Thamel is not what you can call Nepal, and it is mainly tourist-orientated. But it is a great place to meet people and shopping for gifts and souvenir.

Cozy But full package. Thamel, know as one of the main Tourist hub of Kathmandu,Nepal. Its the place for travelers , shoppers and entertainers. One can get anything of your choice. The place is cozy but its the full package for all. Its recommenced to walk at the evening for explore more about Thamel as its less traffic at evening.

A good place to enjoy an evening in Kathmandu. A crowded market square with lots of tourists and shops. It is like any other old Indian town with narrow roads and by-lanes. However its a safe place and you can move around and enjoy the night life. Nothing Nepalees about it. People are good and helpful. You can enjoy an evening in Thamel.
Sights, sounds & tastes of Nepal. Fills your senses with this wonderful area of the city. So much to see, taste and do. A shoppers paradise for things to take home as mementoes.
What a lively spot. Exciting, buzzing, alive! This is the main area for tourists, very safe and friendly with great music bars

Essential visit while in Kathmandu. It is NOT necessary for you to book a walking tour to visit Thamel while you are in Kathmandu. You can explore the place yourself like I have done so many times. Thamel is a very interesting place with a pub / bar specifically for mountaineers who come from across the world. Apart from that, you will find shops with curios, bars, dancebars, restaurants offering superb chinese food and even hotels. The vibrancy of this place is awesome. The goodness of the Nepali people is evident when you are here. Even being a very big attraction for tourists, the vendors and shops will definitely not try to cheat you. Yes, most items are overpriced but no cheating. Feel free to walk the bylanes of Thamel and enjoy an entire evening drinking, watching beautiful girls dance to hindi music in the dancebars and have a hearty meal.

Visit to Thamel Market. In the Thamel market of Kathmandu you will find shop regarding hiking items,woolen cloths and wooden art items.There some veg good reg restaurants too.You can find vegetables and fruits too.Must visit market.
nice and memorable place.. no matter where are u from and whom u r with, thamel always welcomes you with a warm and great heart.
interesting and busy. Interesting for a first time visitor. Some nice restaurants and very colourful. After a while, the busy-ness and sameness becomes somewhat wearing.

Thamel is safe. There was rumours about Thamel that after earthquake it is unsafe zone. Although we used to stay at Thamel in our previous trips, we stayed out side Thamel on arrival days but after the great conversation with the owner of Pokhara hotel we decided to go back to Thamel. We booked hotel situated in Thamel and we got surprised to find Thamel exactly same like before. We understood that it was just a rumour. As in past Thamel is awaken and opened. It is really different fun and delight to stay in Thamel. All major restaurants,shops, bars, clubs and hotel are in Thamel zone. We found it always great area to live and vive.

Heaven for Tourists. Pros:a. There are lot of pubs, discos, Dance barsb. There are lot of good eating joints where you can try one of the best Momos of the world.c. There are lot of local shopping places where you can buy local dresses, souveneirs, and some gifts for your families and friends. d. You can do Bargainig as much as possible.

Wow . Was looking forward to shopping & we were very happy with what we found. Prices are better than good & everyone is happy there. This area of Kathmandu promotes the more traditional crafts of the culture. Other regions can be quite 'Westernised'.

A great area to be based. Stayed here at the start of my Nepal adventure ,close to all attractions,lots of shops to stock up on hiking gear,some shops have genuine gear,others very good copies,can bargain too!!souvenirs,book shops etc great restaurants,a really good buzz around and can meet many other backpackers.Lots of travel agencies selling bus tickets, tours etc..Better to get a hotel on the outskirts or one of the less busy streets as can be loud and crazy with all the traffic...enjoy

Nice place for tourists from abroad. This place is the place which I think is mostly focused for tourists. Trek, expedition and even travel in Nepal is mainly focused from this place. Lots of shops for different travel, trek and expeditions items.
Another week in Thamel. Always a good place to shop, eat talk to locals, bargain, find something for a different gift than normal.

Busy busy, but everything you need in one spot. Thamel is not the prettiest part of Kathmandu, nor is it the quietest. But you will find everything you need there! Great trekking shops, souvenirs and also a few hidden cafes for a break from the madness. A few short hops in any direction and you can get lost in a maze of streets while you explore the old city. Curious local shopping alleys, with temples around every corner and much to pique your curiousity…
Shopping district for tourists.. Great spot to shop for outdoors clothes and gear. Also has food outlets and coffee shops. Locals are friendly and it was a safe area for tourists.

A total Paradise for tourist. I love its colour and its beauty.it is the place where millions can join in one place.Different countries people are unite here and take its pleasure that only made for them.Here is life and colour. What you want cloths,souvenir,meal of your choose that may include pizza to mono, Chinese verses oriental,Thai,Nepali,Indian,Tibetan food, you get everything.Lots of money exchange, gift. shop,jacket shop,leather goods,tiny dancing wooden doll.all wooden handmade items , all kitchen items,famous bakery,cake shop,ice cream shop,tibeti woolen carpet,thanka,lots of t shirts with nice hand made Nepal's wonder stitch.everything,total 10 days I roam every corner and take its pleasure.it is a sweet memory.all tourists are generous and smile with each other all shop owner and people of thamel are very attractive and have good behaviour.They are gentle and love every tourist and smile and want to help and say hi hello to everybody with own inatiative.I love you Thamel.leave as you are always and keep all the tourist in your body as same as always like this.
Thamel after earth quake. Situvation is getting quickly as it was in earlier stage.But some difference.All shops are closed by 8 pm except few.

OMG, did not have enough money with me!. I went crazy buying all kinds of little gifts for family and friends, tried to support the local woman's business by buying a suitcase full of slippers, scarves and tea. I am set for my next camping trip with everything needed to survive. The stores, the restaurants, the smells, the noise, the people, the busy street. It is full of life day AND night!

Something to look forward to in Nepal. Thamel is a place overflowing with activity. I am writing this after the earthquake that devastated Nepal this year (2015). Thamel is one place that I would miss if it is not able to go back into normalcy. People who have not yet visited Nepal would surely would have missed it a great place in Nepal. If people would be visiting Nepal after theeearthquake I highly encourage going to Thamel and by that also helping the people of Nepal to be back on their feet.

Good for shopping in Ktm. Thamel has a variety of shops, from typical handicrafts, clothes, jewellery, books, cafes and so on. You can take several hours looking at a variety of different things to take home. I visited on a Saturday afternoon and was easy to walk around as there were few tourists in the neighborhood. For this reason, it was very difficult to negotiate prices. Sad about it as shop owners depend on tourism which has almost disappeared.

Best place to Explore. Thamel is happening place in the Kathmandu, The place is bustling with shops, restaurants and pubs you get good jackets at the reasonable rates and cafes offer the best sandwich. one best place to explore for a explorer.
A great base to stay. Very convenient and walkable. Loads of interesting shops and food places to visit as well as sites like Garden of Dreams. We could have spent more time in Katmandu.

Amazing. What a laid back place to wander, eat, beverage and shop. I really enjoyed all the antique shops and tge occasional sit down for a real illy espresso. This place come close the Bab al Yemen, in Sa'naa.

Tourist hot spot. Glad we weren't staying here as it was loud at night and busy.
Only place we got offered drugs too.
But still a must to visit, amazing from shopping, bars and restaurants.
A very different Nepal to which we saw on the rest of our trip.

Tourist Destination but be carefull. Thamel is the tourist destination but people are very witty. Be careful when ever you go to any bar or disco. shops are full of traditional Nepalese souvenirs and BURGAIN is must to GAIN.

After the earthquakes. Its a nice place for tourists. Specially for tourists, shoppers, trekkers and travelers. You can get everything in one area. Good food, all type of accommodation. Different type of bars and clubs. Its safe to travel around for both men and women. Local people are friendly and helpful. But keep one thing in mind, because kathmandu is a earthquake zone nowadays you should choose hotels with good architecture and strength, which u can understand by the pillars and beams of the building. They may be a bit costly now. But life and security comes first, isn't it.
Thamel rocks. Awesome spot, very busy, lots to see and do and many places to have a good time. Well worth a visit, great to get into the spirit of Nepal.

Good. Crowded lights fun and good environment with large choices of hotels and restaurants .. seems like recent earthquake couldn't shake it's beauty. Now its more like adventure rather than just roaming around as earthquake may hit anytime. . But believe me that earthquake hasn't affected 98% building around here and 90% building are safe even in case of another large earthquake as big as last
Fun place with all you would need.. I am staying in Thamel for 5 months and I really do enjoy here. I do not have to go far for anything I might need.

Overload for the senses .-). Great funky place - hope it did not get too badly damaged in the quake....Its full of tourists and locals alike - there is lots of sound, smells and colours - a real overload for all the senses!!!
pure tourist hub. roads are very narrow. otherwise like the place. to see thamel properly walk walk n see. lots of good restaurants, bar & cafes in thamel.
I love it. Great touristic area , a lots of fare priced hotels , restaurants and nice bars, candle light dinner is normal to have almost in every restaurant.

the best place ever for shopping and eating in ktm. there are soo many shops that sell beautiful items to take home for a gift, postcards, maps, t shirts with special Nepali style of embroidery, scarves, clothes, Maithili art and crafts. Plenty of coffee shops and restaurants that offer western as well as oriental cuisine.

Short walk to visit some shops. was very busy but the vendors are not pushy good prices on some unique items we had a wonderful lunch at Fire and ice. The local people are really trying their best to get their life back together after the earthquake.

Do the tourist beat. Thamel is the downtown tourist beat in Kathmandu. A stay in KTM is not complete without a visit to the place. While I visited this after the April 25th earthquake you could still feel it was a very charming place. The narrow bylanes are a treat to walk thru and you could spend hours just checking out the stuff on sale. Its quite the destination for mountaineering shopping if you are a buff. Everything from headlamps to sleeping bags to portable stoves and climbing sticks is available not to mention some excellent winter wear. I am dead sure you will end up buying stuff you dont need - such is the charm of the place. A must if you visit Kathmandu at any time of the year.

Tourist central. Thamel is a place to love and hate. On the one hand it is a narrow teaming warren of tourist shops and restaurants with cars, motorcycles and pedestrians vying for space, while on the other hand it has anything a visitor to Nepal might need for food, supplies and accommodations.

Tourist attraction !. Centrally located tourist attraction of Kathmandu, where you can enjoy your vacation with shopping, night life and many more. You can get cheap hostel to expensive hotels to stay.Cheers !!!

Heart of Kathmandu. This is the center of the city, which houses most of the major hotels, restaurants and markets. A tourist-haven, Thamel is the right place to shop for souvenirs, gifts and memoirs.

The best place for shopping in Kathmandu. You can buy anything in this place especially if you plan to do trekking in Himalaya or wherever. If you can't find it in this place it means that you don't need that equipment
can'tget enough. Thamel is shopping heaven for all adventurer. Go there and you will find everything you need.. I don't even to bring anything from my country, just a small day pack and money..

Love the vibe. We have stayed in Thamel 4 times over the last few years....we love the chilled atmosphere of the many different travellers from many different places. Love the handicrafts - anything from pashminas to cashmere or Yak wool throws to felt decorations and kids bags to handmade paper art work to paper mache baubles and boxes and much more. We usually eat at OR2K as the food is always yummy, the service is always good and there's always interesting people to meet.
always like to be here. thamel is the place of the tourist,however even we nepalese like to be here all the time.loves to be in thamel all the times,many things to be seen in thamel .

Brilliant selection to take home. The choice of goods, if you want some mementos of this fascinating city, Thamel is a good choice. Their are shawls, hand knitted socks, carpets, gongs, brass bells, embroidered shoes, tea cosies, wood carvings, knives, bags and myriad other items. For trekking, I managed to get all the gear I needed. For essentials like quality waterproof jackets and trousers, wool blend socks, there are genuine stores (Mountain hard wear, Northface, etc) and for probably not genuine, even tho the labels look the real thing, bargain hard at the smaller shops which are everywhere. Dozens of good restaurants and bars and a great nightlife. Souvenirs possibly cheaper in Bhaktrapur. Stores sell a wide range of foods, toiletries, cosmetics, medical items,but you may have to try a few to find something specific. You need at least a few days to see Thamel, and use it as a base to visit the temples. I had five days and it wasn't quite enough!

Post-earthquake Positivity. Dear Happy Travel ---Kathmandu's Thamel is NOT in shambles !I was in the Thamel for the 7.9 earthquake and also for the 7.3 after-shock. I slept in my hotel (no damage) and lovingly wandered the entire Thamel for 3 weeks after both hits and found, delightfully so, that my favorite hang out cafes and restaurants were either fully intact or had minor damage. All had reopened a few days after the quake. Thamel abounds with any cuisine of your fancy, fabulous bakeries, great coffee houses, shopping --- it is the Mecca for cashmere and it is the perfect Mecca for pre or post-trekking. The Thamel is a traveler's Old World Dream complete with narrow, winding streets, loud noises, horns beeping, soft music coming from shop interiors, rickshaws and street food vendors. The shopping is nothing short of fabulous. Northface and Columbia sporting articles, clothing and gear, can be purchased. They will be knock-offs but I purchased items and found them to be of good quality. The REAL Northface store is on Tridevi Marg.The world will return to the Thamel because we will not stay away from the lovely Nepalese people, their culture, the Himalayas, and Mt Everest.This includes me.Happy planning for a STILL most serious destination !

Culture. when in ktm, i spend all my time roaming the streets of thamel.. quaint bookshops.. mecca for trekking equipment.. yak wool stuff… awesome music and food.. true an overdose of nepali culture...

Convenient. I have never stayed here before as it is definitely an area meant for tourists. That being said, you will find all the comforts and conveniences you could ask for. Wifi everywhere, good coffee, bakeries, etc but don't get me wrong, you will find Nepalese restaurants and a bit of culture as well, though it might be too comfortable and ultimately discourage some from wandering the more noisy, dusty, loud and complex streets of the real Kathmandu

Thamel. Thamel is well worth a visit. It is in an old part of Kathmandu but it was relatively unaffected by the magnitude 7.8 earthquake on 25 April 2015.Thamel with its generally narrow streets offers a wide choice of things to buy ranging from gifts to take home to family and friends to local produce. There are also great photo opportunities.

The place to go for your gifts to the family. Thamel is an area, where you have many options to buy just the things you need to bring your family. Don't hesitate to bargain the price. You're not expected to pay the mentioned price. Just bargain. If the price doesn't come down to something reasonable start walking out, and the price will drop quickly as you walk.

Typical tourist centre. Thamel is unaffected (physically) from the recent earthquakes. It's a typical tourist area found anywhere, with the good, bad and ugly. If you want to buy trekking equipment and clothes-this is a good place to do so. Its restaurants and cafes cover the whole spectrum from bad to good. I encourage people to try some of the small, Gurkha, restaurants with only a couple of tables as well as the more 'conventional' restaurants. The touting isn't as 'full on' as some other Asian countries, however, if you ask for a price of a souvenir from a street vendor, expect to be followed for some time with various offers being made - none in an aggressive manner. I found the vendors well-mannered. ATMs are found in many places although some have caps on the amount you can take out (often R10,000). Try looking past Thamel-in particular in the old town/bazaar area south of Thamel and across the river to the north. Here, you won't find many tourists.
hustle and bustle. Too energetic, business and activities all through day and night. Seemingly commotions all around, but then that is the way of going around in that place.

Tourist district.. You can find almost everything in this area. It's lively place with a bit confusing road. Main place for a tourist to stay but if you stay outside this area, there is no need to come to visit this area specificly.

Shopping and good restaurants in the area!. Thamel is a busy area with lots of traffic and many small shops. You can find same very good restaurants too. Unfortunately after the last earthquakes the city has become empty and many shops were closed and no cars around. The only sound you could hear were the helicopters of the american army.

Impact of Earthquake. Thamel has been changed by the earthquake of April 25, some of the shops have no electrical power, buildings have been damaged and there are less tourists/trekkers in the area. However there is still the excitement that is Thamel, the old and the new, the locals and those who are passing trhough.

souvenir tour. the neighbourhood ideal for your last days in Nepal. you can find everything there. from yak wool and cashmere till climbing equipment and restaurants and hotel. walk in the narrow streets and beware of your things!

Food and shopping paradise. There are a few good place to get a feed in this area and the hotels in this district are good too. Relatively easy to navigate but this area gets very congested at night and around weekends. Very good bargins on basic outfits that got me through Nepal and Tibet. This place is worth having a look at.

A good Shopping Place. This area is a happening place in Nepal, you can meet people of all ethnicity and diversity , Clean and shopper friendly, good eateries and souvenir shops. A place for all ages to buy. Good and eateries in all ranges

Amazing place to hang around !. We spend a night on 24 Dec 2014 before depart to Lukla ,and 3 more nights after the trek on 1-3 January 2015.Its our base for several days in Nepal.This part of Kathmandu amazed me until today , great people ,and atmosphere, we would be back !We stayed at Gaju Suite Hotel on A1 complex , and managed to do a lot of sightseeing , shopping and food tasting in Thamel.The area packed with restaurants, bakeries , hiking gear shop, tour operators, grocery shop, antique shops, singing bowl and souvenir shops , bracelet , necklaces , Gurkha soldiers stuffs , tea shop ,money changers , wet market , tidbits shop, hotels , lodges ,clothing ,pashmina shops ,about anything you could imagine !Some prices of goods, souvenirs are negotiable, foods prices are reasonable and delicious !We are worried about this area ,after the earthquake and after shocks , heard that many tourists fleeing this area.Hopefully Nepal's tourism will bounce back as soon as possible.Worth a visit !!
Great shopping. Spent quite a few hours just wandering the streets. The people were friendly and very interesting to watch. Lots of different shopping mixed with old temples.

A safe haven in a wonderful city!. We visited Kathmandu in early April, 2015, and experienced a place very rare in this world. We felt we were in a world where people really care about people, e.g., we're on the way to visit OR2K from our hotel Friends Home and tried to take a shortcut through a back street and the local guys immediately informed us we had made a mistake--the shortcut was a dead end and we needed to go back and take the next street available--much appreciated. The restaurants we visited were very good, we found the best shopping on our whole trip and the merchants were very helpful in whatever we requested. We were relieved to learn our hotel had survived the quake and our wonderful guide, Suyash Sharma, was safe as was his family. We loved our visit.
Shopping here when the earthquake struck!!. Don't know what is now left standing but it was a great place to wander around peeking into little courtyards and also do a bit of shopping for North Face.

Tad disappointing. The secret Garden of Dreams is worth a visit when in Thamel. Otherwise, its the usual village Main Street with small shops selling knick knacks.. If you're looking for shawls or thangka paintings then you won't be disappointed, but there is little else.
busy and artsy. One of the busiest area in Kathmandu, filled with tourists. I love seeing the art/graffiti on the walls, and the many small cafes/bars/restaurants around the area.

25th April'2015. 25th April 2015, When the devastating Earth Quake hit the Kathmandu Valleey I was infrnot of SAARC Secretariat in the middle of the Tridevi Sadak, Thamel..
Seen the Quake devasation live..
Beep beep. Thamel is a lovely town in Kathmandu... With small streets it's easy to get lost! It's full of tourist shops and hiking shops (which have great deals)

What a city centre!. Amazing place to stay while in Kathmandu, Nepal. It has everything traveller needs: hotels, shops, great restaurants and bars, chill out places and loud clubs, and most importantly great people!

Tourist Paradise. I just love the atmosphere in Thamel. The aroma of food, the various items being sold. Thamel is a trekkers paradise. You can purchase all your trekking gear in Thamel, cheap!cheap! And bargain!

Bizarre Bazaar. Thamel is about one thing: trying to distinguish between multiple examples of the same thing; from baseball caps through pashmina to hiking trips. Thamel is a warren of almost identical alleys with almost identical vendors flogging almost identical tat. Don't venture too far from the main thoroughfares: the maze quickly turns into muddy and squalid lines of shelters when the poorest people live. It's not threatening, it's just very sad and not what you came to Nepal for. Spend an hour in Thamel, buy a few bits, then go somewhere else. The garden of Dreams is close.

Visited before earthquake. We loved it, even it was a little polluted and very touristic. But people still is welcoming everywhere here and you still can find real prices. Many hotels so you can compare on site. No really need to book prior.IMPORTANT :It is 60Rs far from airport by bus. Bus should be taken 600m down away from airport parking.Everybody helpful there except taxis as in all airports all over Asia.Don't buy any north face readymade jacket, you can find a sewer that will make one tailor-made for 4500Rs with cap and water proof using second hand or new feathers !

Great place for visit . when I heard about thamel.people are said me only negative things.but when I came my self in thamel I got absolutely different I mean thamel is a small but beautifull city as well as touristis.here ,visiter can get different kind of cloth like nepali hand made sheep woolen, pashimina and some other kind of clothes  Here you can get lower price to higher price of hotel and guest house and good travel agencies /treakking agencies(some of not will be good)they will charge you more than 300%so care full some treakking agency .so other than thamel is good and enjoyable place .l like it

Thamel is a very neat market. Shoppers' paradise with many things to buy. Thamel market is narrow but so well maintained. A must visit. There are also many restaurants such as Spice Garden (you get great food hear - near Kathmandu Guest House). A must visit. We ended up going on more than 3 days.

Hope it recovers after quake. We would have lingered much longer had everything not been disrupted by the great earthquake. Such a tragedy. Hoping it recovers rapidly. Such amazing shops and corners. Paper, lights, beautiful

Best place to shop and eat for budget travellers. A bubbling place for tourists, where food are plenty and full of variety, and the souvenir shops so tempting with all cashmeres, bags, T shirts and Nepalese souvenirs sold at competitive price (if you know how to bargain, that is). You can get lost here for hours

over -rated ... the so called back area of kathmandu known for massage parlours, shopping andsnooping around is more of a fad of yester years... narrow streets and old crowed shops....one can just pick good Tshirts here only...rest...no good

Place to visit. This is the totally tourist place you can get lots of thanka, pasmina, Neplai Khukari , Singing bowels etc. it is small town but which made for especially for tourist . Place also very clean and safe to walk at night also. We loved this place very much .

Pashmina is the winner!. Nepal is one of the best pashmina producer. You will find many of pashmina sellers along the street and as well with other souvenirs related to the arts and the Nepal's heritage. Be very careful because a lot of vehicles passing rapidly and many people walk here. You could be left behind or lack of concentration.
Lhasabarthamel. Best place in town with good food , best live music every night with various band , best hospitality n cozy environment. ... be there guys open time 11 am to 12 am

No thanks . I only stayed in this area in Kathmandu so I don't have a lot to compare to, but with all the drug dealers and impolite locals it's not that great. Lots of western places to eat and book shops but it's intensely touristy. not my cup of tea.
