Pokahra also very good place to see panoroma. if you have time please go to see mount Everest by mountain flight by plane. you can see panoroam and top of the world. subaru travel Nepal is making you very good tour and special discount on mountain flight. try some other travel agency and come to Suabru travel Nepal then you will be surprised. you can g This is in Jyatha Thamel Rum doodle Restaurant building 1st Floor. you can see Patan ,Bhaktapur and pasupati boudha in only x in 15U$ per person if you are 4 parson by car Please contact there by telephone 4215778 or just email info@subarutravel.com and home page is www.subarutravel.comI am sure you will enjoy in your Holiday with Japanese and many language Guide,

THE MAGIC PLACE TO STAY. Thamel! Read 'magical'! What a glorious mayhem of noise, aromas, colour, movement and total chaos, all mixed together to form the most enchanting part of the world available! In Kathmandu, it's the ONLY place to stay, to eat, to be!!
Thamel. lots of travelers to meet, great food, good beer, fantastic live music. Also, good shopping. Too much noise and traffic, though.

Thamel. http://damnedandbeautiful.blogspot.co.uk/ Have you ever wanted to step out of your house without a set plan in your head, leaving behind the tick list of places to visit and setting your foot on the road with no destination in mind. Just grasping every moment the place has to offer, moving along as every turn surprises you with sights so splendid. As you wander around aimlessly, giving your heart the freedom to choose it’s own path, eventually submerging within the crowd.
Run down. You could call it cultural but it is run down and the streets are clouded with choking gritty dirt. Traffic is chaotic and very dangerous for pedestrians.

A good place to shop. This was my second trip to Nepal and I love all the shopping in Thamel for souvenirs for friends and family. It's also really easy to bargain shop because each shop has 5 others like it right next door.
Thamel is the happening place. Loved the walk through the streets and window shopping

Mix & Match. such an interesting place with stores, temples, art galleries, eating houses, money changers, ATMs and fruit sellers....every city should have a place to mill about that is in walking distance to hotels so that a quick meal and/or shopping experience can be fitted it...well the Thamel area is just that ...all needs from a can of tuna to sleeping bags or cashmere jumpers.... have fun just remember there are no street names so try not to get lost!
Organized Chaos. Tourist friendly, and busy. Many shops, restaurants and hotels to choose from.

Endless shopping. Innumerable streets full of shops where U can find whatever U can imagine, especially different religion-related stuff. The most impressive thing for me were book-stores containing tens thousands publications on Buddhism and Hinduism.

Tourist souvenir shopping heaven - a few tips. Bustling with tourists, vendors calling to tourists, vehicles weaving their way down one lane streets though people, cars & motorcycles, and the ever present smell of incense, Thamel is a unique place. If you complain about Thamel it because you don't accept Kathmandu for what it is...There is dust, there is exhaust fumes, you're usually walking in the gutter (there are no footpaths). If you stay for more than a day, I recommend a mask as you walk the streets.The store owners will say "Namaste" as you walk past, so please be polite and reply with the same or just a smile. If you do just want to look around (it is free), they are helpful, and enthusiastic. Some may find that pushy, but these are salespeople. A gentle "no" and all is fine. Grocery stores, laundry services, fair trade clothing, and all manner of hand made goods are available for barter and a fair price.

Shopping and Touristy. There is lots of stuff being sold on the street... and very enticing as well... but make sure you bargain like crazy... i found the rates here to be as much as 5 times prices... so you got to watch out that people arent taking you for a ride.

Great place to get your feet on the ground. Thamel is a great place to start your trip. The entire area is very tourist focused, and while this does mean the prices are a bit higher for food, shopping, etc. it's a great place to stay for a few days while you get acclimated

A "must visit" in Kathmandu. Busy, dirty, exciting, loud - a place where you can spend days by walking in the small streets, looking in the shops and relax with a coffe or beer on a rooftop restaurant and watching the busy crowd below you. Many restaurants and cafés have free WiFi.
Not a stand-alone. This is well worth it on the Durbar, Asan and Thamel Loop.

Fascinating. It is a great place to stay as it it is in the centre of the whole tourist district. Craziness;frenetic;touristy;bargains;loved it. The restaurants cater for all tastes and the prices are fantastic. You can collect any bargain from all sorts of Nepali gear

Tourist destination. Fine place to visit if you're looking for touristy souvenirs. The hawkers are somewhat assertive. You can find some deals on trekking clothes and equipment, if you should be so inclined. Check out Thamel House Restaurant, a really great place for Nepalese food and entertainment located in an original Nepalese building replete with wood carved windows and woodwork.

Lovely Chaos.. What else can you say? Thamel is crazy, colorful, nervous, always stimulating, overwhelming at times, filling your senses with amazing, and occasionally foul, sights and sounds and smells. You have to experience it to understand. We spent 5 days total here (before and after a trek) and felt that was about all you needed. The walks into the labyrinth of alleyways and streets filled with objects, people, and meat were nothing short of mini-adventures into another world. We never felt unsafe though, but we also always kept our minds about us, dressed appropriately, and never had a lot of valuable with us. Pilgrims Books is a good place to shop, as well as Summit Books, anything on Mandela Street, The K-Too restaurant, the morning buffet at the Kathmandu Guest House, and the Fire and Ice pizzeria.
Found it very cleaner as the rest of the area.. Actually, I liked Thamel very much. It was very near the Hotel where I stayed, walking distance!

Mission Mountain Day Tour. I visited Nepal last automn and bought flight tickets and tours from Mission Mountain travel Agency in Thamel. The agency manager Mr. Binod Simkhada is a very nice person and their service is excellent. I got everything on time as planned and for good prices.I had to cancel one of the flight tickets from Bangkok to Kathmandu and it is done without problems (just a small service cancellation charge).I recommend sincerely using Mission Mountain travel services in Nepal. Moiz Terem
Unique place. Quarter of shops and restaurants full of fake north face and etc equip - but ok for one trek - at least much cheaper)) also many souvenirs and fake tankas

Madness!. Thamel is chaotic! There is so much going on, it almost takes it out of you by the end of the day! However, it is a must if you are in Katmadhu, even taking a walk around the area is a fantastic experience, with things going on everywhere! Shops are good for some real bargains also!
organised chaos. people watching, shopping, dining and accommodation in the centre of all the action
shopper's paradise. Thamel is very tourism but anyone wants to buy outdoor equipment and faked northface clothings, this is the place you must go. Bargaining is a piece of art here.

lots of trekking shops. Huge quantity of trekking shops, gifts and other "tourism" shops. You will be tierd of it in a short while.I think the best is to go off the main road to smaller streets and to discover nice restaurants and pubs.
more tourist than nepali. the area is more conjusted for hotels and shops. the area is at the center of kathmandu. you can get any things in the thamel area. but to crowedy
HEART OF CAPITAL CITY. i like to funny & amazing environment ,good & great services,but onething loadshading donot like this.

Business. Thamel is the business and touristic center regarding shopping. You will not find malls - good! The business is based on smal/mid size shops. Do not buy the fake s...! A North Face jacket for 10 USD can not be a real offer, it is rubbish - nothing else!

I miss it!. Thamel has many great restaurants and lots of little trinket stores to visit. Take your time ambling through the lanes visiting and inquiring about prices first before you make a purchase. Things are also cheaper and less hectic in the morning which is when you should do your souvenir shopping!It gets hectic in the afternoon and early evening when not getting hit by a taxi or bike becomes your main priority when navigating the street.Interesting characters roam through the streets, from hippies to the characters who whisper hashish in your ear and then run away. Thamel is a nice, familiar break from what can be the craziness of Kathmandu.

Enjoy for a few hours - then you'll be glad to leave. Interesting for a short while - do your souvenir shopping and then escape from the persistent rickshaw guys, tiger balm sellers and the belching exhausts ...

Place for trekking gear and books. Bought most of our trekking stuff from a shop call Shona's Alpine. It is owned by an Australian man, friendly and chatty. The people in the shop gives good recommendations on what to get depending on your needs. I find the quality of the gear in this shop pretty good. They don't give discounts though. It is located near Fuji Hotel / Gaia restaurant / Kilroy's. We also bought a number of books from Pilgrim's Book House. They have a restaurant at the back too. Great place.

Want to Buy a Rug, T shirt, baseball hat.... typical tourist shopping filled with cheap trinkets. Fun for an afternoon. Visit Pilgram Books for a host of interesting reads on every topic under the sun.

Tourist area. Did not enjoy our time here.It is an area with lots of shops selling tourist goods. If you wish to buy souveniers then this is a good place to go but otherwise there are better areas to visit and stay if you want a more local experience.The right place to go if you wish to interact wth other tourists.

the heart of Kathmandu.... ...with plenty of shops, restaurants, also a couple of supermarkets that you can buy much cheaper the same souvenirs you find at the shops without having to go through the same discussion again and again...
Lively district. Everything you want and need can be found here! Albeit at tourist prices. But still cheap by most tourists' standards!

Crazy, bustling center of Kathmandu. Thamel is crazy, bustling, alive, noisy, and freaky. You can find there everything! Name it - they will find shop with it for you. Handicraft, souvenirs, restaurants, cheap hotels, tours, fresh meat, books, and spices - EVERYTHING is there. This is one of the most touristic parts of Kathmandu and it's sooo easy to get lost there. Just take your time and after some time you'll find your way home. In the evening there are power outages, but every single shop has own diesel power generator - take torch and face mask to be able to breathe. During the day it's really crazy and people are trying to sell you things you don't want or need all the time. It happened to me many times that I was offered drugs or other attractions (especially when I didn't want to buy watch or tour to Himalaya), but I refused 'others' as well, haha. As I mentioned earlier - for shopping - the best area. Of course, check few different places, as prices may vary.

What a place. Really let's be honest: There are so many people, so many taxis, so many motorbikes... It's really polluted and dirty but it's a very funny place. Shopping, Food, Pubs, and of course: Meeting funny people all around. It's abig mixture of hate and big love... :-)
A must to visit. Lots of local craft shops, places to stay and eating places without that tourist feeling. Good place to network for travel information and booking treking etc

A treasure trove!. Wonderful collection of shops and eateries where you can feel the real pulse of Kathmandu! Shop till you drop and still have lots of money left in your wallet. Silver jewellery, felt handicrafts, antiques, shawls, Kashmiri crafts, furniture, paper products and t shirts are some of the items you can splurge on in this district's labyrinth of shops.

Tourist Hot Spot!. You like those movies with the crazy climbers in them? You know the dare devils that scale mountains one legged half drunk even at times? Well Thamel is the hub of tourisim for the Himalayas. It's like the Everest Base camp away from Everest Base camp. Every kind of backpack, camera, hotel, trekking agency and hotel and restraunt can be found on this little crammed street. It is extremely fun to walk down and be asked if you are interested in the numerous items displayed on the carts all around. Everything from Jewlery to extremely large Vases and even Swords and such. A have to spot when your in Kathmandu - and a great place to look for affordable accomadation too ;)
Nice shopping neighborhood. Lots of trekking related stuffAlso a good place to start exploring the rest of the cityAnd theres lots of places with english menus and european kitchen

Just ordinary. Budget & medium hotels,bars & restaurants along with shops for every item-this is how Thamel can be described.Very crowded,difficult for pedestrians to walk & the worst part so called agents troubling the tourists.

Tourist hangout place in Kathmandu. This is the night life of Kathmandu full of restaurants and bars and hotels. Samsara travels and tours have really good deals with the hotels located in thamel and is hotels is inclusive in the packages..

Thamel market is great!. We stayed near Thamel market on our honeymoon and the place was so addictive that we kept coming back! There are so many things to see and buy that it's really difficult to cover the entire market even in two days. There are some great restaurants around and be sure to haggle when you're out shopping, otherwise the locals tend to suggest outrageous prices if they sense you're a tourist!
Good for a quick walk around to take in daily Nepalese life!. Interesting area to walk around, but very chaotic!
The main hub. Although slightly nervious, crowdy and noisy it gives good chance for those who just-come-and-go... restaurants, hotels, hotels, shops -all in one!

Beware motorcycles!. There are some great shops here and there are some really ordinary ones, and there are hundreds of them. The worst part is the traffic pollution and the fact that you run a serious risk of getting run over the minute you step off the pavement.

Ruined by traffic, sleazyness, drug pushing.. Thamel could be a great tourist area, as most of the good restaurants and budget guesthouses are there, but these days it becomes impossible to walk without the danger of having your feet run over by motorbikes and taxis as the roads are very narrow. As elsewhere in the city, vehicles rule.........pedestrians watch out! It's also sleazy and noisy and not the place for a restful night's sleep.
Shopping. Loved the colours and vibrancy but disliked the stall sellers who pestered to buy.
Night Life. Nice place to hang out, when you are in Kathmandu.Especially at the night. So many Bar with nice Beer and cocktails.Live music as well...
Busy little Nepalese town. Quite alot of shops where u can buy cheap souvenirs - scarves, knitted headwear, Nepalese clothing/ bags etc. Very busy roads though...

Thamel. The main area of the city where all the backpackers and travellers will usually be staying. loads of great night spots ect not to mention the t-shirt making shops where you can go in with a design and they will make it for you!
Outdoor equipment shopping paradise. fakes and originals you'll get it all here. Bargaining is expected. :)

Tourist area of Kathmandu. This is the major tourist area of Kathmandu. This is where the majority of the hotels are located and the majority of the restaurants are located. It is full of shops where you can buy just about anything - hiking gear, grocery stores and souvenirs. The main complaint is it is crowded with no sidewalks with cars and motorcycles going by with inches of pedestrians. The one good thing is it is so crowded the cars are only moving 5 miles per hour. Having said this you can't visit Kathmandu and not visit Thamel.
Shoppers Heaven. Bargains at every shops. Stay at the Eco Hotel which is a quiet little backwater with super rooms, service and food. Shop til your baggage allowance is full

Thamel the tourist zone of Kathmundu. Thamel is a rather busy area in Kathmundu. If you want to get around Nepal Thamel is the place to be cos all the tour companies are presented here. There are pretty nice hotels for different budgets and a lot of different types of shops. I like to get books when I travel and Thamel had the best book shop in Nepal for me named Pilgrims Book House. However I didnt stay out too late in Thamel and times I did i ensured i wasnt carry too much cash or valuables. I am told that at night, security may be a concern as the streets get quieter. Otherwise Thamel is a very inexpensive place to live, shop and know Nepal.
Shopping. This is a wonderful way to get a sense of Nepal. Be sure to talk down the price.

touristy and overpriced. Avoidable, horribly touristy and overpriced, you can buy the same things in Patan for a fraction of the price. Narrow roads and not worth it - there are nicer places in Kathmandu with more atmosphere and better buys. So disappointing!!
Nightlife but not safe. This area has many night clubs and dance bars but be cautious as once can be cheated at these places and ripped of one's money and valuables

All-You-Can-Have Street. Backpacker zone, nightlife spot or trekkers’ meeting point are amongst descriptions to portray the multitasking Thamel, a favorite to all tourists. Exotic restaurants and café, remarkable souvenirs, best priced lodging to travelling agency and sports utensils can be found herein with ease. Certainly, to some extents, haggle in shopping perhaps helps to avoid an overpricing quote. One half or one third of offering price often has you arrive at the best deal but willingness to leave is a necessary tactic.Additionally, Thamel locates in a convenient site from which you can reach other neighbor destinations within walking distance, including Royal Palace, Durbar Square and City Bus Park which services local buses plying between Kathmandu Valley center and Patan, Nagarkot, Dhulikhel and many more. Be it a short or long visit in Kathmandu, to stay in a guesthouse in Thamel is reliably worth your choice.

Dusty, busy, annoying at times. Good for a walk through but it drives me nuts. It is best to do your shopping in Patan where is it quiet and has a better atmosphere. Still there are some things that you can only find in Thamel.

All Roads Lead to Thamel. If you are in Kathmandu sooner or later you will end up in Thamel. Good food, cheap clothes and an ice-cold beer awaits you. It's the commercial hub and centre of the tourist industry with narrow lanes and people of all nationalities in an eclectic mix of cultures all adding to the hussle and bussle which is Thamel
Liked the place. Bought too many things there. When you walk to Ratna Park Busstation you will find more interessting streets and cheaper!

Best tourist hub in Kathmandu, Nepal. This is the best place to visit and eat different type of meal. This is more like any European or American style where you can use the WiFi when sitting in the restaurant.... Different then other typical places in Nepal...

Easy to get lost in the hustle & bustle. But worth at least a short visit to meet other travelers, enjoy food, and shop. The street are narrow, filled with cars, bikes, vendors, and tourists. It is hectic and busy at almost all hours of the day...maybe except the early mornings. Great souvenir shops. But keep in mind that this whole area is geared for making $$ off of tourists....there is nothing authentically Nepali about it. If you do your research on where to go before you arrive then I can assure you it'll be a great time...but it's easy to get lost and overwhelmed if your unprepared.

Sensory hub.. The people watching and shopping are incredible. Many nice woolen items are available. Fabrics can be purchased and turned into beautiful outfits in two days or less at minimal expense. Great restaurants can be found throughout Thamel.
Shopper's paradise. This tourism spot is a backpacker/tourist haven. Great food and amazing bargains!

Beware of the 'hindu' spot sellers..... Interesting architecture, great photo ops, blah, blah, blah! There are the religious looking folk that look the part but they experts at extracting money from your hand. The put a red spot on your forehead and then ask for an obscene amount of money that would nearly fund the next launch of the space shuttle! I give money so much more freely when I am not conned....anyway there is also the women and men selling what looks like semi-precious stone necklaces for chicken feed....buyer's beware, my friend bought one, turned out to be plastic and quite frankly, it was ugly, I actually don't know what she was thinking! :)

TOURIST CENTER. This place is really happening place and a hub for all tourists in kathmandu.You get everything what ever needed and market is open for 24 hour .This place is known as heart of kathmandu
hub of tourist movement. lots of the tourist visit it for the shopping & the enjoyment.

Absorbing place, despite the chaos. This certainly the place to stay in Kathamndu .. the bikes, cars, animals, and pedestrians all seem to move in a system of organised chaos, which make sit quite a challenge initially, then fun ... great food, great shopping and quite near most public transport
Tourist trap. Boring unless you like bars and restaurants and throngs of tourists like anywhere else in the world. On the plus side, Thamel is near to the old heart of Kathmandu.
thamel. I've been in thamel I have a lot of time to go on shopping in thamel, so many thing s to choose from and it is cheap price anything that you want even for souvenirs you can see there

Great for shopping. Thamel is a great area to find many different souvenirs ranging from beautiful pashminas, to intricate jewlery and fierce looking gurkha knives. You can also find different teas and spices in many different stores.

Thamel ... not for everyone.. Some people seem to really thrive on the energy of Thamel ... I enjoyed it, but could only stand it in short doses. The chaos, the noise, was all too much for me ... but I'm a pretty low key guy, so take that into consideration. The shopping is good, although most of the shop keepers are overly aggressive (and prices are much better in the Khumbu). Still, a fun experience ...

Dirty, crowded, loud. I wouldn't really stay in Thamel again -- the hotel was fine, but the place is jammed, dirty, loud, and not particularly pleasant. About the only thing going for it is that it has a lot of places to shop.
It's backpackers central. Thamel is the happening place in Kathmandu. Lots of places to stay in all categories. Great food and lots of interaction with other backpackers and locals.
Buzzing, safe and friendly. Fabulous atmosphere. Great shops, food and people. A really safe place to wander around. Staying in a hotel here is very noisy - that's the only downside

Ideal for shopaholics. In all these narrow streets you can spent days and days.Many souvenirs and restaurants and hotels.it is a pitty there are so many cars and motorbikes drive through these streets.At night it is noisy so I can recomment the Horel Melungtse near ringroad.At night very quite

Multi-Cultural place in high season. Thamel is really crowded in high seasons and you can find too many people from all over the world walking in there and coming to explore Nepal! There are also too many hostel and hotel in Thamel. You can find all the souvenirs and handicrafts here. It's not so chip in compare with other places, but you can find all your needs. The shops are open till about11pm and there is safe area that always have light.Moreover, there is two big supermarket and bakery that you can buy all you want. Accommodating in Thamel is highly recommended.

Dirty and poluted. Maybe the title could be unfair in a country with so many electicity and water shorcuts, and other serious social and economical problems. But Thamel reflects all of them: dirty roads, polution, beggers, and pedestrian fighting for space with cars, motorcicles and others means of transports. You can read a travel book that said that this is lively, interesting or exotic, but .... I disagree.

Sir, Would you like to Jump and Pump?. My stay in Kathmandu was full of surprises. Though one cannot fail to notice overwhelming socio-cultural influence of India,there is stark difference of opinion when it comes to Sex,Sensuality or even the larger issue of status of Women in Nepal vis-a-vis India. Being an Avid travelling I've traveled across the length and breath of Indian Sub-continent., yet nowhere one can find women as empowered as they are in Nepal. The retail sector is mostly manned by women; be it the groceries or slaughter houses, women are simply everywhere.( INFACT MOST OF THE BUTCHERS IN THAMEL AREA ARE WOMEN) Prostitution though rampart, is yet illegal in India. The sex workers and their pimps are mostly cast away in the darkest corners of the town. Men from decent families fear being sighted in the so called 'Red Light' areas. The prostitutes cannot be imagined to co-exist in a decent neighborhood. There is a sense of hopelessness and despair amidst the artificial projection of festivity in prostitution dens;But Nepal was different. The pimps are not apologetic; Sex workers themselves are not ashamed of their profession. Kathmandu's Sin City, strangely harmoniously coexists within a regular neighborhood . This was something that I found particularly striking. This was closest I got to Nagaras and Mahajanpadas described in Kamasutra. Consistent subjugation and foreign invasions in the past millennium have destroyed what would have been a similar culture in India. Though western influence seems evident in the dressing sense and atticates. The routes of this culture of liberalism are deeper.After 8 pm,Thamel region comes to full glory. Be prepared to be pitched by pimps who offer literally everything a Man could ask for. Cocaine, Marijuana, Hash Weed LSD, Sex, Massage all this within a bustling bazaar. in the center of City! Thamel also offer perhaps the best option for shopping if you are travelling on a Low budget. the variety and quality of goods available here is comparable to the best in South Asia if not better. However be prepared to listen to cheesy propositions as you are lost in the shopping experiences. I was moving out of a popular shopping joint when a pimp said "Sir, would you like to Jump and Pump?

Needs more care. I liked the idea ,however the Government should take care more about that place from cleaning , people and car traffic.Even the shops they are all the same items and they don't know English.
paradise for shoppers. this place is very fmous amng the visitors and tourists. u find a lot of cheap hotels and eating points. plus here u cn find nice masks and clothes to buy.

Just watch for crazy drivers!. It's a pretty lively little area that feels surprisingly safe. Just pay attention because the drivers are insane there! It was fun to go to the shops and restaurants in the place with my husband and friend.

get used to it. it is a noisy place, in a way it has nothing to do with Nepal! but for tourists for sure necessary to have all the shops in one small area. I don't like people talking to me all the time and trying to sell something, but also there you can find polite and nice people, so at the end also Thamel is a good place!

Superb shopping with tourist prices, just haggle and have fun. The Thamel district is where most of the hotels and restaurants are located, but what they are best known for is the great shopping. Yes, you will pay much more here than if you were to find the same items just 1/4 mile away, but at least this can give you a reason to bargain with all the shopkeepers. Buy the art, necklaces, curios, etc. because you never know who might need a gift back home. To give an example of the bargaining that can take place- We started by looking at art and the first price we got in the heart of Thamel was about 8000 rupees. The exact same piece of art 2 block away and 4 days later was now 2500 rupees. Don't feel bad to make low offers, especially if you are going to be there for a few days.

Thamel, a weird and wonderful place. Elitists pooh-poo it. I love it, while secretly still booking a room at one of its hotels. I love it. The whole unnatural mess of narrow lanes with motorcicles zooming past your toes, dingy or classy caffes and restaurants, hotels of every kind and budget, offers of tiger balm/khukri knives/hash/girls (in that order), pashmina shawl shops, outdoors equipment shops, tourist trinkets shops, any kind of shops - the whole thing is just fascinating. Plus, there is Pilgrims Bookshop and Restaurant: most definitely the best bookshop in the world, for those who still appreciate shopping for books in a real bookshop, and not online. Not the best restaurant, but passable. Then there is the now expensive, but still worth visiting, even if for a coffee or tea, Kathmandu Guest House, which maintains its old charm.
Night life. Nice place to enjoy night life and i dont like little bit narrow place
A very lively and enjoyable area!. You simply cannot visit Nepal without spending some time exploring the delights of the Thamel streets!

Fantastic Shopping Area!. You can buy everything you have on mind. Back streets of thamel are plenty of secret backyards, founts, temples, etc etc. Worth to take enough time to explore behind the crowded main streets.

Plenty to do. If you're in Kathmandu, be sure to stop in Thamel. Great restaurants, loads of shops selling everything from clothes, art, jewelry, dvds and rugs. Can easily spend a day cruising the markets of Thamel.
Excellent for trekking gear. Great shopping and restaurants. We 'lost' a suitcase on route and had to buy a lot of trekking gear which we were able to do at reasonable prices.
A bit crowd. a crowdy place but many place to enjoy. i love this place from some cause but i also prefer to stay out of thamel for some cause. so better to stay for short time in thamel.

Epicenter For Foreign Travlers. We like to measure how far something is from Thamel, especially so the Kathmandu Guest House.I tell people who are headed to Nepal to leave the kitchen sink at home- because you can find it (for much less) in Thamel.Excellent choices from a variety of purveyors for any kind of trekking, hiking and expedition gear.Good food in great restaurants, and many (many) choices for perfectly good, low priced places to stay.Thamel teams with traffic and never sleeps.Always something to see and do.
Backpackers' paradise. This is the place all tourists stay with a big variety of food, hotels, guesthouses and drinks, supermarkets and all...

Kathmandu lives here!. Amid all the dinginess, crowd, chaos and confusion, this is where Kathmandu lives, breathes and eats - and yes, shops too! My wife bought almost everything on display - from silver jewelry to yak-bone trinkets, and from clothes to Thanka paintings. We saw street-corner sloganeering, and political meetings, were mistaken for drug-peddlers on the night streets, and experienced, beyond all the kitsch, some very serious good food. There was Chatamari the Nepali pizza and piping hot Tyngmo and Richosi at the authentic Tibetan Tashi Delek. There was good Japanese, and even better Italian - the best we had since leaving Italy, and better than anything we have tasted in the US or India. There are some very good bakeries too. Even the quirky chocolate momos were treasured by our kid.

trickier now traffic is in thamel. Thamel has for the last three decades of my visiting always been the place to shop eat and meet people. It has been nearly 6 years since my last visit and now cars and motorbikes are allowed in thamel it makes it not quite such a pleasant place to spend time wandering through. It is not thick with traffic but it is definitely harder to stroll around now. You still must not miss it but a little more caution is needed when there. As a tourist for a short stay it is the place to be .
himalayan advisor. this travel and trek ajency is really helpful and excellent staff
Great shopping experiance. you need to walk around and bargain a lot,Shopkeepers say little more cost for the tourists
Best place to stay in Kathmandu. Great place to hang out, dinner & drinks.. Best place to stay in Kathmandu. Great place to hang out, dinner & drinks.

Fun but overrated. Like any tourist district Thamel is packed with bars, pubs, restaurants, souvenir shops etc catering to the average tourist's need. But let me warn you it can get really crowded at times. If you want to enjoy real Kathmandu, get out of Thamel.

Be careful when buying. Lots of shops, lots of places. Be careful when buying Tshirts. I always buy a couple for my niece. This time I noticed a very strange smell in my luggage. It was coming from the Tshirts. Could be the dye they use... I don't know (better not to think). After washing the clothes at home, the smell still remains.

A must visit in Kathmandu. Thamel with it's small congested alleys boasts of a most number of tourists. Great place for souvenir shopping. Fun bargaining place, sometimes more than 50%. Great lines of restaurants, bars, dance and whatever you can think of..

Most touristy place in Nepal. Best place to buy Souvenirs. I went to Thamel 3 times on our visit to Kathmandu. As someone who loves shopping, this is the perfect place to buy souvenirs for friends and family back home. There are also alot of restaurants on this street as well as shops that sell mountain gear if you are thinking of hiking or trekking. The only problem is that you have to bargain alot here. If they ask for 1000 Nepal rupees, you should start bargaining from 500. Also, be careful of motorcycles as there are many on the road. :)

Backpacker heaven!. Colourful busy streets, packed with shops and cafes. Lots of good places to eat and buy 'genuine fake' outdoor gear - good for clothes like down jackets and fleeces. Every kind of food you could hope to find. Lots of souvenir, book, map and craft shops. Bustling, and a great place to potter about.

Local shopping area !. Good deals on winter gear and clothes. Feel free to bargain heavily - atleast 40 -50 % of starting prices. You can get some really good deals on music cds, DVDs, wool clothing, jackets and winter wear.

Crowded place. Thamel area is a typical tourist area. You can find shops selling climbing gear, books, handicrafts etc., Apart from that there are several hotels/restaurants catering to individual tastes and the prices vary according to the comfort one requires.Overall it is an experience of a lifetime where the old has not still given way to the new. The roads are narrow by lanes and it is an experience trying to avoid vehicles, especially motor cycles and bicycles.

Trekking gear and food hub of Nepal capital. This is one of the most crazy noisy overpacked with shops, eateries, humans place in Kathmandu. And it is obviously the most useful place if you are not on an organized package in Nepal or staying in a 5*hotel. This is the place especially to start off your first visit to country. On my first trip to Nepal i have spent almost a month inside it without seeing a city, so much it was enough for me at once:) On my second trip, i understood that some things of Thamel can be better outside of it too. Particularly the accomodation choice. I personally like Thamel for is the wide range of available trekking gear at the incredibly comfy rates, good selection of books (if you are passionate reader, you must visit Piligrims Bookshop) and music CD's. Stay here for 2-3 days maximum to arrange your trip through any of numerous travel agencies around (and you can get pretty good deals), to stock up on missing trekking gear, to have some original coffee and genuine German bakery and to spend your last Nepali rupees on souvenirs for friends and family back home.

good shopping. I have a good shopping time in thamel. I like the clothes in Nepal. It's very special. I recommon u buy a clothes or dress in early of your trips. That's a good looking for your photos.

Everything you need. Thamel is only place in Kathmandu which can cater all of your need. Hotel: Many hotel to choose according to your budgeFood: Various restaurant serving various food from Italian to Indian and from American to ChineseShopping: You will find shop in every house. You can buy cloths, souvenirs, cds etc etcTravel arrangements: too many to choose and compare the priceOverall Thamel is the best place for tourist catering everything you require.
Manic place. A great place if you like shopping for souvenirs or want immitation of trekking gear. Absolute bedlum and great for a day or two, after that it's just too much!

Thamel is NOT Nepal. Thamel is the tourist ghetto of Kathmandu, where all things 'western' are available -- from Swiss chocolate to French wine, Japanese cameras, Irish pubs, English football, Italian coffee, German sausages, Australian didgeridoos American beefburgers and Austrian beer (happy hour), not to mention the Swedish massage (happy ending). Of course most imported goods are actually made in China, whatever the label might say (check out the Adidas, Nike etc. label shops on Paknajol, the street adjoining Thamel). Mornings can be spent eating bacon and eggs covered with a synthetic honey, afternoon can find you surfing the cold-coffee bars with free Wi-fi, and evenings can be spent prancing about like a puppet at the Fire Club, or else, if you prefer more local customs, joining in with the Nepalese and Indian men in the P**sy Bar (with shower).Thamel has certainly got sleazier and sleazier over the years and more aggressive too, especially when the clubs turn out around midnight. It's getting expensive, too, for although guest houses are still relatively cheap (around 10 dollars), food and drink prices (including the Italian coffee), have rocketed. Most shopkeepers, although not all, are out to cheat you, quality of goods is shoddy and/or counterfeit. Thamel is fun for a few days but don't get hooked (or run down by a crazed youth on a 250cc scrambler). Go trekking or out to some small town -- see how most people live, see the real Nepal, because Thamel (Kathmandu) definitely isn't it).

Anything and Everything!. A stroll or bicycle rickshaw through Thamel will bring you to book stores, singing bowl shops, felted crafts, fine jewelry shops, kukuri shops, lots of Indian/Kashmiri goods, trekking gear shops, bakeries, cafes, hotels. Wish they would make it a 'no motorized vehicle zone.' People everywhere in the streets shared with rickshaws, motorcycles, cars, and amazingly even trucks plying the streets all at once!
Good place to shop and eat. Before heading for the hiking trips, you can buy all your hiking equipments here, very cheap price. And also you can buy your trips, hiking permit and so on over here.

Remember to bargain. This area is full of shops most of the selling souvernirs and mountainware. From the prices I suspect most are not real brand clothes. Many restaurants for every taste. Too crowded and with busy traffic in streets that were not made for vehicles.

little heaven after travelling through India and Bangladesh. the mix of East and West. nice food at reasonable prices. Friendly people and a perfect base to plan you next travels or mountain adventure. Fantastic rafting, mountain trekking etc.!Definitely coming back for more...
What a great place!. Cool vibe. Something for everybody here -- not just the hippies. Great mix of people and foods from all corners of the planet. I'll definitely come back.
lively and exciting. we stayed in the area of Thamel because of it livelihood. the steets and filled with wonderful restaurants and great shops.
Interesting. Thamel visit a must, busy hectic, full of trekking gear.. The veg market worth a short visit
Crazy, but fun. I love Thamel, but I also like leaving it too! Touts always after the tourists and women with babies. Crazy during any festival times, like Holi, or New Year's Eve.

I am surprised at the negativity of previous reviews. I have to say that I surprised at the negativity of previous reviews of Thamel. I have come visited Thamel over the past two decades. In that time it has changed remarkably little while the rest of Kathmandu grows and sprawls around it. It is quite a unique place in the world, even within Kathmandu, and I wonder if some of the frequently negative comments come from people who have not travelled widely or have little experience in such environments.Thamel is a loud and crowded backpackers and trekkers ghetto in the centre of Kathmandu. It is a small maze of narrow lanes, packed tightly with cafes, restaurants, budget accommodation, discount bookstores, jewellery shops, thanka and art shops, and many, many shops selling expeditionery and trekking gear. Some of that gear is top end and imported, some is left over from previous mountaineering expeditions, but a great deal of it is "North Fake" style counterfeit outdoor brands, such as North Face, Columbia, etc. The gear is likely to be goretex, but not genuine brand - amazingly cheap prices for take home purchases, but I wouldn't necessarily stake my life on it in the mountains.Thamel becomes a loud nightspot in the evenings, with many music bars, and young travellers looking for a good time. And there are plenty of good times to be had. There is definitely a seedy side to the Thamel night life, and you are still likely to be approached on the street by someone whispering of a possible drug deal, or similar. Avoid these at all costs. Frequent the popular bars, night spots, and only stay at the better budget guesthouses recommended by Tripadvisor, and you will be fine. But like many similar precincts around the world, you need to act sensibly and keep your street smarts about you. Watch your belongings at all times, don't be pursuaded to make purchases that are too good to be true, and don't seek outout the dingy back street places, drugs etc or you may end up getting yourself into trouble or being ripped off very quickly. I always enjoy returning to Kathmandu, and even though nowadays I no longer stay in budget accommodation, without fail I always visit Thamel at least one evening per visit, to shop for bargains for the family and enjoy a fun night out!

thamel the worst place. we stay at raddison which was a wonderful experience , but by our badluck we also visited to thamel the tourist place where we were robbed by locals at ' jugal dance bar 'we only take the two bottle carlsberg beer but they bill us 15000 rs . they bit us by refusing so we have to give them 10000 i.c. we request to nepal official to look afterthe thamel visiting tourist .

A must see while in Kathmandu...but be careful. When you go to Nepal to go trekking, while in Kathmandu you have to visit Thamel just to see what its all about.Thamel is a area of Kathmandu with tons of little hole-in-the-wall shops that sell fake name brand trekking and climbing gear. It is a great place to find souvenirs and any gear you may have forgotten at home (just know that it is fake). There are a couple of 'real' shops like Mountain Hardwear, North Face, and Lowe Alpine.Just be careful when walking around this area. It is a known tourist hot spot so there are plenty of people there to take advantage of you. There are several beggars on the streets and many stray dogs that sleep during the day. Don't carry anything in your back pockets and if you carry a backpack make sure you have it zipped and many people wear them on their fronts so you keep your belongings close.After dark the scene in Thamel changes. ANYTHING can be bought in Thamel after dark.If you planning on being out after dark on the streets of Kathmandu you had better bring a headlamp because there are very few street lights and the sidewalks get really dark.Overall, I would definately recommend going to Thamel, just do so with caution. If you are careful and don't get yourself into bad situations, you will have fun.

For shopping excellent but stayed elsewhere. Didn't stay in Thamel while in Kathmandu but visited it regularly. I love this place.Particularly at night time this place is alive, not that you will see anything due to lack of lighting, this is what makes it such a cool place to be. Just watch out for passing motorbikes which seem to fly past in all directions. The best tip I can give anyone is to haggle your a** off with the guys if you are interested in buying but if not be polite and just say no thanks. They are keen salesmen but are not aggressive and enjoy the banter. There are some excellent places to eat here, not that I can remember the names but as always be careful what you eat. That goes for all places in Kathmandu. I didn't feel unsafe here at any time but we were never down there too late at night. Stick to the main street maybe as a precaution.Enjoy

Nov 2009 - At this time, Thamel is safe for western travellers, but only in daytime.. worst place ever visited. Thamel is the worst place i ever visited, other places in KTM is much better. Especially if you are a nepalese/indian please do not visit this place. These hoteliers only care about dollar/euro carrying people, they even wont give rooms ( paying same amount as others) and if you find one, it will be the worst room in the hotel..( there will be TV but no remote, phones will not work). If you ask about remote they will say it has been given to other guests ( read other as people with dollar/euro). I am a nepali and i felt humiliated by fellow nepalese in Thamel, i sincerely believe one day all tourists stop coming to this horrible place and than only those hoteliers will realize how to do business. Dollar/Euro carrying tourist be warned that they charge you too much, i recommend you all to look for accomodation elsewhere in KTM..simply said hotelier at thamel sucks!!

A good place to stay. Apart from shopping and drinking there is not much to do in Thamel itself (we spent a whole day trying to find something). And beware ALL tourist attractions are closed on tuesdays, if you're there on a tuesday there is nothing to do apart from go to shops and restaurants. Don't go into the massage parlours either, my partner and I being naiive travellers thought we were going in for a trekkers massage and came out with a different opinion.

nightmare!. thamel maybe good for shopping but beware of the bars especially the dance bars!!! there is one close to the music shop where customers are ripped off royally!!! if only we knew this.. the bill for a can of beer came as 8000 Nepali Rupees!!! when refused to pay they threatened and an army of 7-8 locals came hitting us mercilessly.. ultimately had to empty the wallet as they would'nd let us go at any cost no matter how much u plead.. extremely horrendous and unexpected experience this was but it is something every tourist should be made aware so as to be careful about their trip to Thamel. Except this episode the overall trip to nepal was great.

Blackpool in The Valley. It all depends on what you want ! Thamel is brash, bustling, crowded, touristy, and a curious Nepalese arrempt to provide what the locals perceive that western tourists want. An authentic Nepalese experience it isn't.If you want a range of good hotels, myriad restaurants (some very good, others less so), loads of shops selling (some) good stuff and (lots of) tourist tat, a huge choice of cyber-cafes, a couple of supermarkets, bars belting out western music, crowded streets, lots of traffic, rickshaw hawkers etc. then it's the place to be. Bear in mind that a ten minute walk will bring you to many other shops selling similar stuff, but probably much cheaper !Give it a go for a couple of days - it's a fun place to unwind after a trek, but don't imagine that it's Real Nepal. If you've only limited time available you'll get a different, but highly enjoyable experience by spending a couple of days in Bhaktapur
